review:
This is the time where I wish mixed recommendations were available.

Gameplay wise, it's fine. But if you want to make your own courses, you need Unity which is a bit advanced for beginners like myself. As a result of this, It is pitted unfavorably against the [i]Golf Club[/i] series which actually uses a built-in editor called the [b]Course Designer[/b]. So... why can't this game do the same and make it easier for everyone?

Also, the menu is a bit cluttered, but... [b]Y[/b]our [b]M[/b]ileage [b]M[/b]ay [b]V[/b]ary on that part.

[h1][b]Final Verdict[/b][/h1]
[h2]5/10 - Average[/h2]

review: Fun for casual play.  Too inconsistent for serious gaming.pros: easy to play, 3 click swing or more advanced mouse movement.lots of courses available, and you can design your own if you want to get deep into it.graphics are decent, pretty smooth multiplayer works wellcons: advanced swing options are horribly inconsistent and difficult to use., clubs are inconsistent,  Swing a club at absolute max and get a consistent distance gauge on it and it will change as soon as your hitting around an obstacle, usually just enough to drown your shot or bury it in sand.  Started referring to them as sand / water magnets and adjust swing to add distance to go over one and decrease distance if there is one past the aim point. Many of the courses have greens that should be a tourist attraction in Egypt.  small flat area on top, steeply sloping sides and surrounded by sand.  Seriously, some of the greens wouldn't be safe to walk on IRL. Several courses, mostly user designed, have a similar design on the fairways.  It's like the designer said, "look...this course would be easy and fun.. Let's turn the fairway in to a bobsled run, and make the greens like egyptian pyramids, that will be great for every masochist that plays!"  If you avoid the user designed courses, these problems are not as common.

review: Sadly not working anymore on my Linux machine. It even doesn't get updates anymore - quite outdated game. Now you are forced to go to PGA 2K11. I liked the Golfing SIM times with Links LS 1997 - 2000 quite a lot - this game was not that good, but closer to Links LS than PGA 2K11. The whole golfing flair with all the real videos of the courses, virtual reality clubhouses and history of this sport is lost. Nowadays it's only swing the club and that's it ... fast-food-golf. Perfect Golf is no exception, but at least it's a nice game to play for a few minutes, when you need a break. There were some small inconveniences - but you can get along with that (e.g. why does the putting grid not automatically switch off when I'm far away from the green ...). You can feel that this was never a A-title, but at least it supported Linux ... even that is gone now. PGA 2K11 with Proton and Wine runs better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000177856', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1634960613}
review:
I've looked at this game in the Steam store for about a year and a half but was always scared away from buying due to the "mixed" reviews I kept reading. Then I did a little bit of research and found that one of the reasons I should love this game is why other people don't -- you can play with the old three-click swing. As someone who blew a ton of money earlier in life on Links and the early TW games, this is just a godsend. Since there are hundreds of courses available for download, the first thing I did was download Congressional CC, home of some of my favorite Links memories.

The metering is a little hard to figure out, especially in the short game, and it's hard to tell when you need to dial up an extra club or two to hit an uphill green or deal with wind -- this appears inconsistent to me, but then on an actual golf course, you never know until you hit it.

In essence, I'm a little sad I didn't buy this sooner. I have to make up for lost time now and since it'll be a long time before I'm tournament ready (if ever), I'm just going to take a little walk down memory lane with a very well designed and executed game. If you're old school, give this game a try.

review: It is a pc golf game.  What more do you need.  It has decent graphics, a fairly good selection of courses, and the play engine seems to reproduce actual golfing close enough to be fun.  There is an occasional change in club selection you didn't ask for so you need to check your setup before hitting the ball.  The greens run mostly true as shown by the ground level graph but every so often, something will pop up to change what you thought would happen.  But, that is no different than real golf if you have ever putted  over a bad divit fix or a poorly fixed cup hole that was not done right.  I have not taken advantage of any of the multiplayer functions yet like tournaments or playing with a friend but will soon.  If I have just one negative about the game is I cannot find a way to create some bad weather.   The game seems to only want to display actual current weather conditions, and I am not sure where a lot of the courses are located.  Something tells me I can create any weather I want, but I haven't figured that out yet.  If you want a good golf game that plays very close to the real thing, the price is right on this one.

its the swing meter. i have a very fast high powered pc with a very good graphics car yet you get a freeze or hang in the swing meter when you take a shot. its random as well but ruins your shot completely and you just cannot do anything about it.
ive check many forums and the one also here on steam and lots complain about it and changing settings in game do nothing to address it.
this ruins the game. the swing is a major factor to playing well but this bug prevents that so sadly i cannot recommend this game

review: This is a wonderful golf sim. Anyone old enough to remember the classic Links golf game will instantly be familiar with one of the swing options, the storied  “3-click”. Graphics are solid, and there are countless free course downloads available, as well as online tournaments available at PGLS Golf Ladder. The game can be quite challenging, but unlike its competitor "The Golf Club", there are difficulty level settings, swing anomalies are rare, and the physics of ball flight are quite realistic. The only thing missing is a single-player career mode which made the Tiger Woods series so rewarding.

review:
After many years, I have resigned from the affiliated PGLS platform that supports Perfect Golf.  The PG game in itself is a myriad of courses that play extremely well however I joined the additional site of Perfect Golf Ladder System to interact and compete with players in weekly tournaments.  Unfortunately  one of the moderators AFFO finds it imperative to win EVERY tournament he enters, Oh, did I mention he was also a MODERATOR of the PGLS website?????? Despite protests to the owner of the site from many of the players concerns in regards to the consistent winning streak nothing was done and this player continues to consistently win all tournaments he enters.  This is not a recent development but has been ongoing for years.  In all fairness the admin of the site proclaims he has done all he can to investigate the claims but says he can find no evidence of malpractice.  

In short........if you are joining PGLS in the hope of becoming a winner then I strongly suggest you simply stick to Perfect Golf and enjoy the game for what it is.

Regards

review: Initially I was looking for a Golf game that would install into and play properly on a Linux/Debian system. JNPG filled that void and is one of the best If not the best, in my opinion, Golf games I've ever played. Now comes the bad news, sort of. I was running a dual boot HDD in a desktop with win 10 Pro and Ubuntu on the same HDD and everything was fine until a win 10 update, at which point I realized that I no longer had sound on my Debian partition in addition to the game dragging despite a 6GB video card (evga 1060 overclocked), 32GB of system ram and a 4GHz cpu. After 2 days of beating my head against that wall I installed an identical Seagate 750GB HDD and installed win 10 on it, wiped the other drive and re-installed Ubuntu. Ultimately, as it turns out, JNPG runs noticeably better on win 10. GOOD LUCK.

review: I bought this game in very early access and I still have it active in my library. Unfortunately I feel that I cannot give it any more time to be developed into even a good golfing game. I keep hoping that the next update will make it enjoyable, but I just don't see that happening. I am about ready to delete it, but I paid for it and I hesitate it to do that. I  don't know that it's fair to compare it to the Golf Club series, but I'm going to say that all the Golf Club versions (even though they have had some issues too) (some versions better than others) have been far superior to Perfect Golf. Perfect Golf's user interface has always been unfriendly and still is. The courses themselves are acceptable, but what is up with the player animations? The golfer swings anywhere on the course are so unnatural looking. Especially the putter addressing the ball on the green. It just takes away any immersion into the golfing experience. After being patient for this long, I would not recommend this game to anyone interested in a good PC golf game. At least I can be happy that I bought at a reasonable early access price. At the current asking price? Avoid.

review: While it's fun to play, there are some issues. I've played since 1970, and can say without hesitation the ball mechanics are all wrong. Roll after landing a mid iron cannot be controlled, there's no "sticking" the pin for the most part. On long putts the path of the struck ball takes the slope into account immediately. Playing a hook on a tee shot does not reward with longer roll, and for that matter high or low loft makes little difference in the outcome. I'd give it a 7 out of 10, but with more ways to control ball flight this could be a 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198890029756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17033, 'last_played': 1606187297}
review:
this is a great Golf game with over 200 free downloadable courses(and a dozen or so that are not free).
every one has the same distance with clubs so only skill and a little luck are needed to win.
Graphics are 7/10 but the Physics are 9/10 (not perfect due to 3rd party course designers can differ greatly) but if you stick with only Perfect Paralel courses it is 10/10.
I have not quite 300 Hrs of play time and still have not played all the courses.
Entertainment Value is 11/10 where else can you get hundreds of hours of play for less than $40?
I may be a little biased having had the perfect golf on 3.5" floppies back in the days of dial up.
I know $40 seems like a lot for a golf game, but with all the courses and community to help you design your own course for free it really is a must have for any fan of real golf sims.
Plus you can play this with your own golf clubs with the added equipment set up I do not have yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219989663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 47870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 337, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1712001563}
review:
The best golf game you can buy. Many of the courses are created using 1m lidar. A designer  created my local course. I've 
played it a hundred times, and every bump and slope is there.  If your not as lucky as me, the game comes with a course creator (course forge), and with a little help from forum members, you can create your favorite course. 

  I started on "beginner" level, and after about 7 rounds, finally broke par. Now, I'll move up to the next level, and see what I can do. This is a good thing...you don't want a game that's too easy, it would quickly get boring. I should get many hours of playing as I slowly get better.

 The game comes with about 20 courses, and there are at least a hundred more you can download for free from talented designers.  I play the game on my laptop with an I7 3740QM and a GTX 680M, with everything on Ultra and average around 40fps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121646551', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1557007931}
review:
I am getting back into golf sims (had Links Pro for the Mac, now use Links 2003, and have tried Tiger Woods 08 and The Golf Club 2).  This game is the least impressive golf sim I have played so far and I will be refunding it after I write this review.

I primarily use the real-time mouse swing in this and the other golf games I play.  My biggest gripe with the swing in this game is that you can move the mouse back and forward in a super slow motion and you would be hitting the ball as if it were a full speed swing.  In addition the swing analysis stats that show up as soon as you hit the ball in the practice driving range do not show up when you play a round.  With no swing power meter as well, in stroke play it becomes a guessing game of looking at the animation of your golfer and hoping you don't overhit an approach past the green.  Yes we can't accurately predict distance in real golfing either, but real golfers know how much swing speed and power their bodies are capable of when they swing.  Computer golfers that swing with the mouse do not have such precise feedback so I feel indicators become more important for both realism and enjoyment.

The short game is another issue in Perfect Golf.  You can note the leftward and rightward slope of greens, but there seems to be no way to tell the upward and downward slope, even with grids.  I did not have that issue with any of the other golf games referenced in the top paragraph.  I also get very little feedback when I putt as to how strong and weak my swing was.  Finally if a putt is missed sometimes the slope indicated in the first putt's grid will disappear as if the slope did not exist.  Basically the display of greens information is inconsistent from putt to putt.

This game's positives are the graphics and animations.  It looks easy to play with others online, but I haven't tried it.  Players wanting greater immersion will be disappointed with only one available male avatar, no career mode, and very limited solo play options.  In addition settings for a stroke play are not saved each time you play, so it becomes annoying to have to look over the 15 or so options to try to remember exactly how you prefer to play.

I have to give Perfect Golf a negative review not because it isn't the best golfing game, but because the two major issues mentioned above take away the playability and immersion that even the basic 80's golfing games I have played for the Nintendo Entertainment System gave me.  If you want a modern golf sim, I suggest The Golf Club 2 (not 2019) over this game.  One thing is for sure: Perfect Golf will not replace Links 2003 as my go-to golf game.

review:
While I can't putt for crap this game is - contrary to recent reviews - working just fine on Windows 10. It comes with many courses and although a career mode would have been nice it does let you twat a ball around a pretty field with a variety of sticks. Just what I was looking for.

However: The short game is impossible - the distance meter bears no relation to the distance you'll actually hit the ball, making any short shots to the green random luck. Add to that the ability for the computer player to freeze on a 3 inch putt, never bothering to take the shot and it's a frustrating game.

I'll keep playing but I'll also keep looking for a competently made golf game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985869577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24588, 'last_played': 1711126151}
review:
Best Golf Game ever made to this day! 
1: Learn distances to play with no markers.
2: Play with no green grids and use f5 freecam (awsd) to analyse your putts.
3: Use motion swing and practice to get a ratio of 0.25. Do some driving range and unclick the yellow tee dot to practice faster.
4: If you hit the ball to the green from 91yards expect backspin, use this at advantage depending wind and green uphill or downhill. To avoid the backspin use your pw at 120yards because some green will roll back ridiculously 100 yards back and thats the way to avoid it.
5: Play on pro tour difficulty. New players, use hacker mode to avoid the swing ratio or else learning all at once will be impossible and you will play +100.  
6: If you do move to tour pro with motion swing, i suggest a very open course or not starting at championship tees. 

This is 100% hardcore!! Goodluck!

Forgot to mention i drop my mouse dpi to 400.

review:
What a garbage excuse for a game. Clunky controls, frame rate issues, a menu system that looks hideous. There is no way to do pretty much anything without having to use their stupid menu system, a menu system that's just icons (and crappy ones at that). No actual game mode, no tutorial mode, and a game that looks like it was made, confusing controls. Also keep in mind if you're stupid enough to get this unfinished mess of a game, you  select a gamepad to use, congrats, you're locked in having to lag round their confusing, barren, sorry, excuse, for a menu system. 

Honestly, if you want a piss poor game, that looks like it was made by a kid with serious mental disabilites, this is your game. Still haven't found a good golf game, but at least unlike TGC, this game has meter golf mechanics. Too bad all of that is hidden beneath putrid crap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331436470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 409767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1587, 'playtime_at_review': 14483, 'last_played': 1712258746}
review:
Pro: Excellente qualité graphique et superbes terrains en général. Assez facile à comprendre les fonctions et subtilités du jeu. Après environs une heure de jeu, j'avais pas mal saisi toutes les fonctions. Il ne me restait qu'à les maîtriser par la suite.

Cons: Le jeu ne compile pas les statistiques comme l'ancien jeu JNGB 6  le faisait. 

Certaines fonctions de l'interface ne semblent pas fonctionner. Il faut refaire tous les choix de partie à chaque partie, il ne semble y avoir aucune façon de pouvoir sauvegarder les exigences de parties...en fait...il y en a une, mais elle ne semble pas fonctionner...c'est ce que je voulais dire par la fait que quelques fonctions ne fonctionnent pas!

Impossible pour moi de télécharger les terrains à partir de la page de Perfect Parallel.

Enfin, ce n'est pas un mauvais jeu de golf, bien au contraire, mais cette version nécessite plusieurs ajustements...en ce qui me 
concerne...qui pourraient être inspiré de l'ancienne version de JNGB6.

review:
Having played golf sims all the way back to Links LS (1998) I can say that I have some experience, and though I had high hopes for a good 3-click golf game with Perfect Golf, I'm pretty underwhelmed.

Not sure what Perfect golf is trying to achieve here.   It's clunky, poor graphics, the menu system seems broken and unpolished.  I couldnt even get to a menu whilst in a game. 

If you want a good golf game with an amazing course editor, stick with The Golf Club series.  It has kept my golfing urges satisfied for well over 500+ hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198722824213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1601375057}
review:
I continue to have problems with the shot controller.  I have a mouse and PC.  I have had no other problems with other games from steam so i am really disappointed.   As is,  the game cannot be played.  50 % of the time I cannot make a shot.

The only work around I found was the flyby.  But you have to do this with every shot to get a the shot controller to pop up... 

Additionally there is something weird with the physics when you use a driver or long iron.  The ball drops in a normal curve and then bumps up and resumes a new normal curve.

Steam refused a refund as I fiddled too long (5 hours) trying to get it to work (2.5 hours is there limit...  so beware of this).  If the game is faulty, get a refund from them fast...  Not impressed at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215935665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 93785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10, 'playtime_at_review': 1449, 'last_played': 1711731873}
review:
You get different comments all over the 'net about this game. There are certainly some improvements that could be made with this game, but the 3 Click system, coupled with extra sensitivity if you don't hit the snap at the bottom just right gives it more of a sim feel. I can't seem to use the motion swing system as it may not be compatible with my mouse, but even if my mouse isn't jiving well with it, I would be content to play 3 click from here on out.

I would say they need to work on the avatar's stance in certain situation/lies. And of course have more varied avatars and/or customizable ones is sorely needed. The pre-shot camera views could be more plentiful, or ideally, a true free range camera. The overhead view in relation to the swing meter should be movable, but that is minor. Sometimes the grid will pop back up while you are putting, even though you turned it off, again, minor. 

Otherwise, some of the proportions of ball to surroundings can look a little off, especially when putting up close, but it's not a game breaker by any stretch.

You can always buy the game, and try it out. As long as you don't play it too long, Steam is good about refunding your purchase fairly quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970273814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6906, 'last_played': 1625778026}
review:
Having read some of the negative reviews in terms of graphics and controls I can only say while some of these points may be valid, the game as a whole is solid and enjoyable. I keep coming back to it if I have a spare half hour or even just 10 minutes. The reason is that it isn't easy. And taking time over your shot pays off. 

Plus points:
- Controls are overall easy to pick up. 
- Intuative game play and decent physics. 
- Good game balance.

Things to improve:
- Alway making the same changtes to the game set-up. It would be nice if player preferences would be retained.
- Graphics, especially in the menu, but also the course, and the atmospheric sounds could be updated. 
- Player A.I. is a little slow.

Real issues: none

Thanks for an enjoyable game. Would love to see more courses :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000236953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1615248159}
review:
At first I was a little scepticle of this game, I am an old Links and Microsoft Golf Player from back in online golf's Hey Day, and no game has come close to matching the immersive feel of Links 2001 and 2003 since Microsoft sold the game off.   After years of searching I gave up looking around 2009.   It was by shear luck that I tripped over this in the steam store and after a couple days of debate due to the $ 39.99 price tag, I thought I would give it a try.   Well, I could not be happier.   This game recreates the immersive feel and simulates reality better then any golf game since Links.  Some people have said in reviews that the graphics are dated, and after playing several courses I am still struggling to figure out what they are talking about unless they expect actual photos of the course.   None of the course that are available are ones I have played or visited in real life so I can not testify to the authenticity of renderings, but they are realistic enough for me.

After playing a couple rounds I decided to visit the community sites to see about additional courses and found an active community with online tourneaments and plenty of user generated courses.   Then to paraphase The Hobbit"- "Something happened that the ring did not intend"  I saw who was behind the project.  Andrew and Mike Jones.  If you are any kind of Links 2003 fan, these were two of the premiere Course Designers from the Links 2003 community.   It was like a homecoming to see those names.   

Pros:  Great Golf Simulator with multiple options to control swing including simulators.
          Over 190 user created courses
          Online Tournaments for most skill levels

Cons:   Putting can be a challenge at amature level or higher due to lack of instruction and a guage that is not intuitive, but as with real gold, once you practice you will get the hang of it.
            The game lacks a long term statistics traking method so you can not track in game your improvement. 
            Game needs more golfers to choose from, the version I got only came with a single male golfer called "Hacker Harry" so female golfers don't have a free option to feel like they are on the course.

I recommend this game but offer the reservation of this is an independant studio and r the lack of golfer animations is the pit fall to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060579490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1518633141}
review:
Really wanted to play a golf game. The Golf Club game was a non-starter without the 3 click option. After installing, the game looked great on my PC. Now off to the other end of the house where I play on a 55" screen using a wireless keyboard/mouse and Steam Link. Started the game but it hung up at the select controller screen and did not give the 30 second count down like it did on my PC. Back to other end of the house and the only way to exit the game was a force quit. Thought I could start game on the PC and then play on big screen but then no sound on TV, only sound was at the other end of the house where PC is. Looked online for others with the same issue and found 3 but no solution to the problem. maybe they ended up using a controller but I haven't used a controller for years and don't own one. Such a small percentage of complaints about this issue and no fix found. Keyboard and mouse work fine with all my other games, even non-Steam titles I play through the Steam Link. Really would have liked to play this on the big screen but got a refund.  :(

Wanted to edit this since I repurchased the game, I could not resist this game and I am really enjoying it so far. Hoping at some point to figure out keyboard mouse issue I noted above and play on the TV. The game looks and plays well at the desk. Still learning and practicing. Even though I was familiar with the old 3 click method, I am working with the real time swing and enjoying that. I would suggest this game to anyone who wants to play a golf game, It will take some patience and practice but I think it will be worth the effort.

After just a few hours I have been able to play a course on par at the beginner level. I play the game with a Logitech F310 gamepad. author: {'steamid': '76561197982177357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1639383734}
review:
This game is just not much fun.

Mouse and gamepad real time swing control is way off.
Move your mouse a tenth of a milllimetre off line and your ball will swing wildly to the left or right.

The Golf Club 2 nailed that aspect of the game.

Putting is better but requires you to be very soft or otherwise the ball will fly to the other side of the green.

It's a 7 out of 10 for mine.

I think this game is purely designed for people with real golf simulator hardware that can interface with this game as  the gamepad and mouse iimplementation is dam awful.

For those using real hardware simulators and  real golf clubs, the sim is probably a much better experience.

P.S. I adjusted my score to 7 as the 3 click control system is very good so I was harsh on the sim by using the extremely harder real time  mouse and gamepad control.

review:
A long time ago I was addicted to Microsoft Golf 99 and it was my idea of the perfect golf game.  It faded into obscurity and ended up no longer supported by the updated operating systems, unfortunately.  I hesitated to buy this game given it's relatively high price but I have to say that for the most part I was pleasantly surprised.  If you've played golf games before it's relatively intuitive and the course design and graphics are all good.  Played on the big screen and using my game controller, it looks great and it took me less than one round to have the controller layout mastered.

If you like a quieter, more relaxing round of golf I think you'll like this one.

review:
After reading some negative reviews I still went ahead and bought the game, and I regret it. 
Honestly, unless you've played this game since before The Golf Club 2 came out, there's no sense in even bothering with it. The Golf Club 2 is better than this game in almost every aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962171557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3372, 'last_played': 1504145900}
review:
Having given all or at least most of the golf games currently available on steam a fair shake, this one is my favorite. I'll try to explain why concisely;

- Simple, functional, easy to use multiplayer lobby system.
- Tons of downloadable courses that are as good or better than the ones that come with the game's original install. 98% are free! Just takes a bit of time and work to download them.
- Different control schemes available, as well as different difficulty settings for them -- this critical feature absent in some other big golf games allows you to learn and enjoy a course, the physics of the game, and playing with friends independently of your progress at mastering a particular control scheme or mechanic. This makes the game accessible, allowing you to up the difficulty yourself as you improve and learn the game -- players just need to take advantage instead of playing at too hard a difficulty level and then blaming "bad controls" which I see a *lot* of in other reviews below. Some seem unable to stomache that "Amateur" is actually a hard difficulty level just because of the word.
- Great overall gameplay & physics, good enough graphics [gameplay is just far more important].

Where it has room for improvement:

- Stability; game has crashed a few times at the end of a multiplayer round, and less frequently but a few times have run into freezing/can't-continue type issues in the middle of a multiplayer game.
- Speed/smoothness of online gameplay; there are endless "click to continue" type popups after every shot, every 9 holes and etc. This mechanic just slows down the speed of online gameplay and becomes more and more of an irritation over time.
- Speed/smoothness of online gameplay; there are just numerous delays between everything in this game and no attention at all in general paid to making the game run smoother, faster, and have any respect for people's time during multiplayer play. You should be able to at least enable an option to skip or speed up the viewing your own shots, and the time inbetween shots is just gratuitous sometimes. Even 18 holes with a couple friends can often be a 2+ hour affair.
- Progression? Stats? Career? Online ladder? Ranking system of some kind? Unlocks based on achievements and ranks? 
- Why not incentivize using more difficult control settings via the non-existent but hope-for-in-the-future systems of progression, achievements, rankings, and unlocks?
-Looking through the negative reviews a majority of them are frustrated because they simply cannot figure out how to set the difficulty of the swing to a good balance that challenges them a bit without being overly frustrating, and can't figure out/can't-be-bothered-figuring-out how to download and install the many popular 3rd party courses, the vast majority of which are free. Why not integrate a course-browsing/rating/viewing/downloading system into the game? Why not integrate a feature that adapts your difficulty settings for swings to a point where you can semi-consistently hit fairways but it still leaves some substantial difficulty there so you can improve?

I'm really looking forward to the sequel to this game. Hopefully it can make the gameplay smoother, faster, more stable -- and even add some elements of progression. I think that would be a huge success and very popular. Until then this is still the best option for a relaxing game with a friend -- but have your coffee or snacks ready it does go a bit slowly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072849970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1571821595}
review:
The game looks good and playing it on begginer settings had me quite excited as reminded me a lot of my TW days. However, that's where the good ends.

I could not get to grasps with the motion swing at all. Too many variables to get right to hit a 'perfect' swing and the smallest of errors with timing or mouse movement cause a hook shot of note. I even tried the 'ruler' trick to try to get the movement staright at least but timing issues again produced nothing but hooks.

So 3 click swing it is. In 'begginer' and 'amateur' 3-click is manageable. You do really need to be close to the mark on the downswing of the meter but I found it quite playable. Pop the game up to 'pro' and this changes completely. A pixel either side of the marker on the downswing and its off into the bush, rough or water. I played through 9 holes and hit the fairway once. Totally frustrating gameplay.

Ok, so I'll stick to 'amateur' then. After having completed quite a few solo rounds I decided to have a look at the other game types. Tournaments looked promising at first. I liked the idea I can play at my own pace and compare my score to others. However, for the 20+ hours over a few days I have played this, only one tournament has been available on a course that is not included with the game that I would need to purchase. Nope.

Right then, multiplayer. Lobby is almost empty each time. Max 30-40 players while I am checking (UK GMT day time). Most on courses I dont have or need to pay for. There simply aren't the numbers playing to make it viable for a range of play types and players.

It's a shame, I played TW from TW 99 on Windows 98 through to PGA Tour 2008 and the multiplayer stroke play was great fun. I was hoping I had found it again but alas, no. The golf club with no click swing and inconsistent swings is no better either.

So that's that. I had really high hopes on my initial play through but as I delved deeper into the game it became overly difficult making it unplayable at the level I wanted and I don't want to have to pay for every additional course.

Not recommended, sorry.

review: Hey programmers, the multiplayer is weak to non existant.  This is a beautiful golf game with good physics, but hardly any people are playing it.  The options for starting games and finding oppenents needs serious work.  Please fix the lobby system by adding lobbys for individual courses and just stack up the players until you have 4-8 to start a match.  You should be starting matches every minute.  There should be tournaments people can join too.  Right now the only tournaments are if you already know the players.  There needs to be a better system for bringing players together.  I know what I'm talking about.  I run an onlline hockey league called X1HL.  The ability to control the flow of players is critical.  Jack Nicklaus Golf needs to work on this and this title will revive.  Don't fix it and this title will be obsolete within a 1 or 2 years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025544845', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18, 'playtime_at_review': 1296, 'last_played': 1712076738}
review:
Удивлен, что так много отрицательных откликов. Мною игра была приобретена в августе 15-го года. Она мне показалась, мягко говоря, немного не доделанной. С 15-го по 17-ый года я наиграл в эту игру всего около 2-ух часов. Однако, недавно, решил проверить что нового появилось и играбельность; ведь за этот период было много серьезных обновлений. Игра пошла сразу. В сравнении с Golf Club, разработчики очень хорошо подошли к вопросу визуализации броска меча. Свой бросок можно рассматривать с разных сторон, обращая при этом внимание на красивый ландшафт и погоду. Да, кстати, погоду можно генерировать с системного сервера, что тоже привносит в игру определенный колорит и реальность. К интерфейсу они тоже подошли с другой стороны, нежели в Golf Club. Сначала после Golf Club кажется очень непривычно, но потом не только к нему привыкаешь, но в сравнении, начинаешь сознавать его преимущества.
 В итоге, я подсел на Perect Golf. Большое спасибо его разработчикам за то, что они постоянно его совершенствуют и обновляют.
 Всем остальным советую этот гольф. В конце-концов, на вкус и цвет..., а мне очень нравится. Всем удачи!

review:

Jack Nicklaus ähnelt sehr stark dem Game von damals.
Wenngleich es ein Stückweit angenehmer zu spielen ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370083324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 27099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1353, 'last_played': 1626632958}
review:
This game is better than it's  reviews may entertain. When your talking SIM, this is as close as you can get with any golf game on the market. The ability to score takes skill, knowledge of golf, and desire. After playing 18 hrs I have finally begun to get down to just about par. 

After playing wgt, twg, and other games, this one by far takes golf SIM to new heights with their new swing motion. I am enjoying playing this game more and more, and have over 130 courses at my disposal. I can understand why some get frustrated, they do not have the patience nor will to gradually become better. Instant gratification is what most desire in today's fast pace world. This game definitely evens the field up, and people don't like that as well. 

Ball effects for differing course agriculture may be better in the future, hopefully. I have seen that cart paths do not quite bounce the ball enough, ruff tends to slow the ball down a little but not enough. Trees do very well in deflecting balls correctly in this game, I love that aspect. Greens react quite well, and I am yet to see an animal exploded from my launched ball. The courses that others have made are first class, and there are many of them. Options for in game settings are awesome. 

Overall, this game takes some time to get good at. This is not a game for those who like arcade over SIM, i.e. pg2, twg over jnpg. If you are a true lover of golf on the real course you will not be disappointed in the accuracy of this game on computer. Bombs away!

review:
This isn't easy for me to rate.  First, I think it is quite fun to play a round.  It does bring back the good ol days of pc golf games.  But that said, it is pretty limited.  You have one avatar and limited selection for modifying your player.  There is no season that I can find, and I usually only see one or two games for online play, which doesn't bother me i just play locally anyway, but if that's your thing be warned.  In the end, I enjoy playing single rounds of golf here, but I don't like the lack of depth and customization.  I do, however, like playing around with the course maker and may one day finish a course.  The developers have great tutorials on doing this, which gives me hope for more custom mods for clubs, shafts, grips, gloves, balls, etc...  

I am recommending,  for the reasons stateds, but realize what you're getting;  the thumbs down reviews are valid here as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966251999', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1640368714}
review:
I love this game, and being on Linux, I am a very happy hacker... In both senses.

Very customizable.  Not too bad to learn to play.  I picked up on the mouse click method and Steam controller method quite quickly.  Never was a huge fan of the mouse movement swing in any iteration of golf games on the PC since Leaderboard Golf on DOS/Commodore64.

The microtransactions aren't too pricey or out of control either.  You start with a good dozen country clubs and can order for $6 or less new ones.  All the fancy cosmetics are unlocked by actually playing the game.

I have yet to get a chance to try out the hotseat multiplayer, but that looks like it could bring back the good ole days of playing a bowling or golf game on the computer as a party game.

All in all, I would say this is definitely worth a buy if you are into golf, and by far the best golf game currently out on SteamOS/Linux.

This title runs perfectly under RHEL7 and Fedora 25 64bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109536056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4388, 'last_played': 1575219985}
review:
First, the good points. If you simply want to play a round of computer golf that looks and feels reasonably realistic and where you feel that the results are down to your own skill rather than pure luck then this will suit you. Using the motion swing control method it will take an awful lot of practice to hit the ball accurately particularly when it comes to putting. After more than 40 hours playing I am still to complete a round anything better than +5.....

But unfortunately the game has a totally unfinished air to it. There is no career mode and, worse of all, no player stats within the game. I find it totally incomprehensible that in a game that stats were created for there is simply nothing. And that brings up the other big problem....no feedback and no support. Very, very disappointing. 

The game does come with a number of courses both real and fantasy which are generally very good. There is also a website where further courses can be downloaded. But that, in itself, brings another problem....the PP servers are currently down and when they are (which is rather frequently) then the downloaded courses don't show in the game and can't be played. Aaaargh!

I would love to recommend this game but in all honesty, regrettably, I can't. Sorry!

Review Mk 2:

After more weeks of playing the game, and whilst I still bemoan the lack of a career mode or readily accessible stats, I have to slightly revise my review.

Whilst I didn't mention it above one of the things I disliked about the game was the infamous "lip out" with putting and the devs have now greatly improved that. And whilst I'm still hopeless at the game (I still haven't done a round in anything better than +2) perhaps it does more reflect real ability than pure luck.

So if you can accept the drawbacks I will give it cautious approval!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980187235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1616273113}
review:
When you have played PGA Tour on PC then everything else is going to struggle. This game is a good generally, there are still glitches in graphics, (the way the players right hand is and sometimes how they are standing) and a few of the usual rules of golf are missing. Having said this the physics are good and the environment looks great and it is the only current golf game I have found for the PC that you can actually play online with friends.
It’s not a PERFECT golf game but it’s an ok one. If you are like us and just looking for a golf game where you  can have a quick round  every so often then this is fine, however if you are wanting a good single player game as well like PGA tour used to be then you would be disappointed.
So I am going to say I recommend this game but only as an online occasional round game with friends.

review:
A really immersive, realistic experience with regular ongoing developer support and communication. The devs genuinely take feedback on board and where applicable, use it to continually improve the game. An ever increasing library of user made courses (some of them excellent) helps to grow the community involved and the game itself.
A multitude of available swing types and difficulty levels and customisations provide a great golf game to suit anyone from a casual 'fun' level experience right thru to as challenging as you want it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033834522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 24887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21058, 'last_played': 1709010002}
review:
This game has been more roller coaster than golf sometimes; the devs have made a lot of changes over the development of this game and they listened a lot to the players, and opening up course design was interesting, and it remians a golf simulator to follow. It does keep changing, sometimes in little ways sometimes in surprising ways. 
After the last update, so much changed that I've stopped playing pretty much. It used to be fun. Tweak tweaks - now it's not fun; it's work and it has changes that I just cannot figure out how to adjust, why they made it, and how can I get back an older version? Putting is a real problem at the time I write this review, and it never was this much of an issue before. So I'm pretty tired of trying to re-learn this game every release. However, those releases also made some great improvements both visual and functional, and their active involvement has brought the game along nicely. (One reviewer seem to think there was no "dev'elopment; I disagree: this game has one of the most devoted dev teams around.
It has a lot of courses, many really good free ones; the basics are all there, it has several levels of play, all of which are too tough for this old guy, and enough free presonalization to make your game look good. They have big plans in the golf world and while some of the bells and whistles aren't there (never missed the crowd noise anyways, no fancy locker rooms to acess data, etc.) there's a lot there, almost everything can be controlled with sliders, it supports really nice graphics, There's an active lobby, several tournaments both 'official' and open, but all use levels of play above the starter level, so your controls may look different, and you may want to learn the higher levels of controls; me I have trouble enough on hacker, or whatever the lowest is. 
The game is very good at recovery, if you lose connections, or in multi-player, you have a good chance of picking up right where you left off. There's an active community base and an active forum, and an at-times chatty lobby.
Overall it is a very well-designed (and still being designed) game with great emersion, simple to learn, hard to master; lots of features and options and seems to have a robust future. Now let's all just get through 2017!

author: {'steamid': '76561198260685049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 161946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37902, 'last_played': 1634769860}
review: What ever changes and tweeks you have done to the game are not aligned with the way the true game is played. There are many flaws and inconsistancies in which the ball reacts vs the way it should. First, let's talk the short game. If I want to have the ball check up, I should be able to control it. This can not happen in the game. There is no stopping the ball once it lands on the green. It is all roll out so lets hope you have alot of green to work with. Sand shots should be able to get spin on them if the lie is clean and the landing area on the green is flat or up hill. This does not happen. again its all role out. Hit it thin or fat? Ok I get that. but missing the snap by a 10th of a fraction and you are penalized!!. c'mom folks get real. Putting: Not really an issue, except. too many lip outs when the ball speed is at a rate and location that would allow it to drop. If the intention is to have all puts drop in the centre cup, then make the hole smaller! otherewise, lighten up on the speed to gravity ratio. AND Why does the ball get spit out of the cup once it drops? Yep. happened twice. slow putt. in the heart, drops in the cup and a half second later it is spit out like old chewing gum. One more thing: I dont mind the forgiveness adjustment on missing the meter whith most tee shots and fairwar approaches, but lets make it equal or relative to all clubs, wedges and Putter. I have up until now really enjoyed playing the game. I am not an "exceptional" player, below par sometines, above par sometimes, but now, i find that the game is no longer an enjoyable exercise. Play well and have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018699460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3675, 'last_played': 1482990539}
review:
ok, so here's an honest review from someone who has played golf and was fairly crap at it, but enjoyed it immensely.

Perfect golf is imo a simulator that makes reward from effort awesome.  A friend of mine bought me this game so he had someone to play this with and immediately set me up with the mouse swing settings.  There are many settings to mess about with with respect to DPI and in settings the speed of swing in relation to mouse movement, however, GET PAST THAT ! and you will find yourself playing a golf game that simulates your own play.   I highly recommend this method of play however there are the other standard 3 click mouse swing options.

I usually find that my first 9 semi sober is not bad, then deteriorating into downswings to fast or pull backs too slow, equating in hooks and fades.  However, when you pull it off ..  the feeling is AWESOME !

Great graphics, smooth gameplay and finally a golf game that Multiplayer is seemless unlike others I have played.

User generated courses which are getting better daily make for some great fun and the option do design your own should you wish.

Play competitively ot casually and drunk as I usually do....  either way ..  dont expect an EASY golf game !
Competitions online are grades from am to pro and by various swing styles.
DLC is available but also MANY user generated free courses that are awesome.

If you enjoy effort for reward games then this is for you.
If you expect to hit a straight shot and par every time ..   then choose another .. this takes effort and practice.

Good Luck.  Hope this helps.

review:
Definately the most promising golf game in years... the physics of the game are almost there.  One thing that doesn't make sense are the sand lies... in fairway bunkers, you are always buried to a certain degree, but in the greenside bunkers you are never buried?  It should be the other way around, although you would sometimes bury in a fairway bunker, but not as often as in greenside bunkers (think loft).  Otherwise very playable, and should be the best of the best when all is said and done.

Update: more than two years ago, a newer more complete version of this game was announced, and since, not a word?  this game, as it stands is incomplete, most of the features are missing or simply do not work... there are glaring bugs in the game that go unfixed... the developers are incognito, nowhere to be found... so my recommendation must change... DO NOT BUY!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057828822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1566503567}
review:
Just wanted to write down a few words about this game now when I´ve been playing a number of rounds.
I´ve been playing golfgames since the Commodore 64 time before the first Links-game came out and I also play golf in real life. Not saying that makes my review more credible, but it may give a hint on what I look for and am annoyed with...

There´s lots of graphical adjustments to suit most people which is good. You have your sound options and of course your golfer customization. You can pick your clubs and equipment and buy more if thas not enough for you. At the moment you don´t have that much to buy so perhaps thats something that will be added along the way. A bunch of golf courses are included and more are available to buy for a few bucks. I´m fine with that. The courses included are fine and varying in style.
You have your practice mode which I think could be better if you had more putting and pitching options and such. Tourmaments are not used much as far as I can see which is a shame. Multiplayer will be your only option if you want to play with other players but my feeling is that this is not very active. You have to work a bit to get a game started. If you just want to play a few holes you´ll probably end up chosing solo-play anyway.

I feel I can go on and on about this so I´ll just end with what I think works well and what doesn´t.

Graphics are fine even though animations could be alot better.
Sound effects are good but the game is really missing commentary. It feel lonely out there too often.
Motionswing is frustration and annying - in other words perfect! That´s golf! :) No seriously I feel they´ve done a great job with that one. You need to practice and you won´t get it perfect all the time.
Putting is hard which is also fine but I don´t like the fact that you almost all the time have to aim 5 meters to your left/right because the greens have such big slopes. That´s just not very realistic I´m afraid. There´s some work to be done here.
As I´m a "leftie" I of course miss the left handed player...

Would I recommend the game? Well...there aren´t too many good golf games out there today so I guess we can´t be too selective here. If you like to play a quick round now and then and aren´t that interested in career modes and the stuff EA:s Tiger Woods golf had to offer, this game should be enough for you. I wouldn´t pick it up for retail price though as I don´t think the game is finished yet. To me it´s still in "early access".

author: {'steamid': '76561198116886926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1474186431}
review:
If I could give it a MIXED score that is what I would do. I resisted the urge to cane it with a negative earlier, instead waiting to see how the games evolved first. Sorry to say that I will also do some comparisons between other golf games as well.

THE GOOD

- The graphics are nowhere as bad as some reviewers describe. On course they are finer than say The Golf Club, I have grown to like the courses.

- Hard on the fairway as well as the green. In The Golf Club I hit almost 99% of the fairways; with Perfect Golf I am lucky to hit 70%.

- Greens are "fairly" realistic. Perfect Golf has much better green dynamics than The golf Club's ice puck surfaces (which is entirely where games are won or lost in that game).

- Has come a long way since Early Release.

THE BAD

- Not sure what the season pass people are going to get for their money?  But if they get value it will mean the rest of us will be stranded with a 75% complete game.

- On line play still has a long way to go before it reaches Tiger Woods 2007, which is where PC On line golf achieved its pinnacle. Sad to say we had a better on-line game almost 10 years ago.

- It feels isolated, there are no active seasons, or competitions (one token tournament)  or any attempt to group players by skill level. I know these next comment are outside the control / influence of the game developers - but in The Golf Club there is TGC Tours which is well run and builds that sense of community. The same is trying to  happen with Perfect Golf with GolfOnlineTourNet, but is a long way from polished and even the hacker league is won by people scoring -40 under.

- Dubious wind physics, while head and tail winds make a difference, I rarely bother adjusting for side winds.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970838451', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1471733563}
review:
Have played golf games for years. Played the Jack Nicklaus golf game years back and made some custom stuff for it. I got excited when I saw this game and bought it right away. 

It has to be the most confusing game I've ever purchased and I'm very good with computers and played many different types of games for years. While I understand this is an indie game, there has to be SOME documenation or direction on how to play. I couldn't get a golfer to actually make one shot. The meter goes as I click it, but the golfer doesn't do anything. Tried moving my mouse around..nothing. Also can't figure out how to add a computer golfer to play a round. A lot more thought and effort needs to put into the helping the consumer know how to use their product. It's too bad as visually it looks ok.

The only thing I know how to do this game is request a refund. I would avoid this product if your are looking for a game you can just pick up and have a nice game of golf.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970429546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1664934838}
review:
What is it with golf games on the PC these days? The PC used to be the home of golf games, these days the available library of golf games on PC are a joke.

The problem with this game is the same as the problem with "the other" one (The Golf Club), the swing mechanics are inconsistent. Golf is a game of consistency and finesse, especially on the green. The control system in this game doesn't allow for either of those things. Having said that, I'm referring to the motion swing mechanics as I'm not a fan of the 3 click method.

If you really want a good golf game on PC and you're not too fussed about graphics, Links 2003 is still available and is pretty much the only worthwhile golf game on the platform right now. Don't waste your money on this, it would be better spent on an actual round of golf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134236476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 36101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5400, 'last_played': 1535359219}
review:
I have had this game since it first came out, initially did not give it a second glance as the game controls were not to my liking. However a couple or so weeks ago, due to circumstances beyond my control I found my self looking for something different. Gave this game another look, and found a whole slew of game controls. Pretty sure there is something for everyone.

I settled in on real time mouse swing as that works well for me in other games. This game gives that swing with a twist in that tempo is also needed for a good swing.

Ooodles of game play levels. Plenty of options and feedback with the practice areas to hone your game control type. Game has a significant learning curve at higher and harder levels which is right up my alley as i like practicing as much as playing. At higher and harder levels the game will tax your cranium to score well and hit good solid shots.

Game is constantly improving and developers are trying to make a hard golf game. Golf is supposed to be hard, so I give extra kuddo's to the vision. However there are levels in the game that also make game play easy, so something for everyone in here.

Competitions and career come from outside fan sites, I have not had the opportunity to fully explore these yet, however they look OK. Fan sites can tend to rid themselves of good players looking to elevate their clique using various BS excuses, so time will tell if this also plaques this game or not.  However in any event the developers have been working on and are improving on computer generated opponets for players looking to compete against like skilled players. The game also has a lobby, something I have also not fully explored however it looks easy enough to find friends and fellow golfers to play with.

Current crop of courses are visually pleasing, and the game play at the higher levels of difficulty make replaying the same courses not at all boring. Additional courses can also be downloaded. You can read reviews and look at videos and photos of courses before deciding to add them to your stable of courses.

Developer also has a future plan to give course design to everyone. I'm looking forward to furthing my course design here.

Bottom line, I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031695454', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 25322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4141, 'last_played': 1594518909}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995230411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1559254908}
review:
Edit to address recent updates:

This game still has too many issues to justify choosing it over other golf games. I decided to take the time to play Royal Birkdale (fan created) on JNPG, Tiger Woods 2008 and Links 2003 (while watching the Open) and found that while PG is sometimes prettier to look at in a screenshot, the gameplay of JNPG compared to TW08 and Links is abysmal.

If I could only choose one of the three, I'd choose TW08. And since there are new real courses still being released regularly and frequent online tournaments, it isn't even a close comparison. Add in the Career Mode and MUCH BETTER physics/swing and I think it is finally time for me to uninstall JNPG for the last time.

Some specific issues from my round today in JNPG; a putt from the fringe while the flag was in the cup resulted in my ball running over the cup and through the flag as if neither existed. The shadow rendering is horrible, and the flag shadow in particular is headache inducing. The follow camera is clunky, the aiming on the putting surface results in annoying redraws that truly destroy any immersion. And before anyone suggests "But you can adjust things", I spent considerable time adjusting and never got to a setting that made me want to keep playing.

End of Edit.

Don't waste your time or money.

Each "patch" breaks more and more, (edited to say...) and more and more and more.

Poor physics, broken swing meter, yardage that is way off, flashing textures on objects, and hilarious devs that forgot that this is supposed to be a game.

A fractured multiplayer community since the OGT site competes with the Lobby for players.

Go play TW2008 or Links 2003... more fun, no headache.

Oh, and "Course Forge" public beta has finally been released. Read EULA...

author: {'steamid': '76561197999780812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 116884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23792, 'last_played': 1669232631}
review:
Quite simply the very best golf sim available.

Beautiful graphics with excellent ball physics.

Many swing types available, including actual golf simulators where you swing a real club and hit a ball off a mat) though I'm old-school with the old 3-click method.  

The company that designed this game (and now has the help from Jack Nicklaus' group) is a highly-dedicated group
of computer golfers, real-life golfers (at least one that I know of is a PGA pro), real-life golf-course designers, etc.

The graphics in this game are also used by some of the TV networks in their golf telecasts.

Also, unlike the big game companies, such as EA Sports for example, these guys don't have any plans to gouge players for a full new version every year.  Yes, some of the licensed courses cost extra, but only 7 bucks for truly tremendous golf courses.  However, most of the new courses designed are offered for free, and nearly all of them are excellent.

Also, there eventually will  be a golf-course designer program offered for free (still in beta testing at the moment).  That appears it will be quite complicated, but for those used to using Unity to make games or games scenes already (not me, unfortunately), the course designer (known as Course Forge) will be capable of the fantastic.

Unfortunately, the online aspect of the game (in other words, playing matches against others online) has slipped...  It's often hard to find a match in the game lobby.

But as a golf sim, this is the best, hands down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997642972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 69215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 356, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1712367676}

Play 10 rounds of the same course, then see if your score improved.  Some people play real golf for years and are still terrible.  As a sim, this one isn't bad although there are a few little things they could do to greatly improve it.  But golf is a very frustrating game even on a good course and a clear day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200268002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1593381180}
review:
Despite the naysayers, I find this to be a truly great golf sim.  There are free courses of every description available and very many of them are fine renditions of courses both real and imagined, though the game arrives with a worthy selection to begin with.  You can set the time of day and the weather.  The graphics are great -- early morning sunlight is wonderful shining through the trees and creating realistic shadows.  You can set up computer players to challenge you or just play alone if you wish (I like a player to join me).  It seems to me that the swing accuracy is good, although I must admit that when your computer partner sinks putts and chips from all over the place it's a bit discouraging.

I don;t know what you might demand of a golf sim, but for my money this is as good as they get, and then some!  So without reservation, I highly recommend this game to any and all who enjoy computer golf.  Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026953190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1487977486}
review:
Vorweg muss ich sagen , das ich seit Links LS 99 , fast alle Golfspiel für den PC gekauft und gespielt habe.

Fangen wir mal bei der Charaktererstellung an. NUR 1 Avatar - männlich - unschön und kantig. 
Die Ausrüstung ( bis auf die Schläger ) sind ein Witz. Es sei denn , Man investiert noch mehr reales Geld.

Der Sound: Keine Kommentare , sich ständig wiederholende Hintergrundgeräusche. Diese kann man aber alle einstellen.

Die Grafik: Hoppla, das ist Stand Links LS 99 aber nicht 2016.

Jetzt zur Spielemechanik: Dieses Spiel ist NICHTS für Anfänger. Die meisten Grüns sind nicht ordentlich "lesbar" auch nicht mit Raster. Der Caddie hat keine Lust oder ist eher in anderen Sportarten unterwegs, aber nicht beim Golf. Da überprüft man lieber selbst. Was sich aber auch als sehr schwierig erweist. Das Wetter ist ein Witz und die Ballphysik bei Wind unglaublich unrealistisch. Aber der Ball schein eh gern das zu machen , was er gerne möchte. 

Nach 19 Löcher auf Platz 759 und einem Score von +27 , dürfte jedem klar sein, dass hier etwas nicht stimmen kann.
Ich bin kein Profi aber eine + 27 ( alle auf dem Grün verhauen ) ist das schon sehr auffällig. Manchmal brauchte ich 8 - 9 Schläge für ein Grün. Putten ist ein Witz und auch die gesamte Entfernungsangabe ist eher ein Glückspiel als realistisch.

Für das Geld , hätte ich mehr von dem Spiel erwartet. Hier kommt Mehr Frust als Lust. Es mag gutes Potenzial haben, aber nicht wenn man nur ein Spiel auf den Markt haut, welches unfertig ist und die Leute zu einer Mitgliedschaft für über 200 Euro überreden will. Schämt Euch, versteckte Kosten hier einzubauen.

Auf den Punkt: Unfertiges , überteuertes , zu schnell auf den Markt gehauenes Golfspiel. Auch wenn ich nur 2,7 Stunden gespielt habe. Mehr Frust muss man sich nicht antun, da gibt es durchaus bessere Golfspiele aus der Vergangenheit.
Also Finger weg, es sei den , der Preis sollte mal 5 Euro betragen. Mehr ist es nicht Wert. Das ist meine persönliche einschätzung und Meinung.

Overall, very pleased with my purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217356468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 56061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3075, 'last_played': 1708536077}
review:
After many years away from any type of gaming, JNPG caught my eye. I've always liked gof games and was a fan of Links for many years.

Although JNPG does lack one or two graphics details, there's no doubt that the actual gameplay is excellent. The ball dynamics are pretty close to what you'd expect on a real golf course, and the quality of the graphics that are in the game is excellent. 

What makes it even better is the community side of the game, primarily that which is driven by onlinegolftour.net. Although not officially part of Perfect Parallel, it's as close as you'll come to an official support site with tours and tournaments, even a world ranking system. OGT also provides downloads for User Created courses, enhancing the longevity of the game significantly.

All in all, I'm delighted with Perfect Golf and consider it a worthwhile investment of a very modest amount of money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967563407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1519062408}
review:
Not a terrible golf game, but there`s a number issues that prevent me from recommending it. 

1. No career mode. Unforgiveable IMO. Without it the game gets OLD very fast.

2. Even with it`s simplistic graphics the game is a resource hog due to it`s terribly optimized game engine.

3.Overpriced add on courses.

4.Sterile, boring game environment with very little ambient sounds.

5.Bugs galore. On Windows 10 it can be annoying, but if you`re using Linux don`t even bother  it`s virtually unplayable.

6. A developer who begs people on their forums to post positive reviews on Steam because of all the negative reviews it`s been getting instead of just fixing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063536777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2665, 'last_played': 1482542668}
review:
As a very long term user of the Links Golf Game I and many others have had to wait an age for a worthy replacement to appear.  There are many Golf sims and I have tried them all but following Microsofts decicion to no longer support Links after 2003 left many Golf players frustrated.  Links did however have an excellent course designer and they are lots of great designers out there who continued to support the game and gave the community loads of great courses to play.
Two of the finest designers then started Perfect Parallel with the eventual aim of releasing this game.  I joined the kickstarter campaign and was thrilled when the game got the Green Light from Steam.  When the game finally arrived I was very dissapointed because the game looked great but didn't play very well.The engine lagged badly so I went back to Links I even made sure that I updated my graphics card to be compatible with Links when I upgraded my computer.  A year os so further on I have returned to this game and I can safetly say that this is a worthy successor to Links.The graphics are beautiful the game supports lots of swing types and you can impliment real time weather for most locations all over the world but these are just small details what's important is how the game plays.  A year on the game now plays flawlessly so even if you only like the occasional casual game of golf this is as goods as it gets.  Those serious about their armchair golf will already have it. One of the coolest  things about these games is the course designer.  The designer that came with Links was fit for purpose but course design was involved and time consuming to say the least.The designer for this game called Course Forge is simpler and more intuitive to use but is not yet available but is due imminently.There are already plenty of cources to download other than those that come with the game from the link on the introduction page from designers that have been given early access and the standards are awesome.  These are now being released at a rate of about 5 a month and this will accelerate once the Course Forge is availanle for all. It would be amazing to see further cources particularly some of the best designs from the Links series.  Mike Jones one of Links premier designers really needs to make the rest of his cources available for Perfect Golf time permitting.How about it Mike?  Who knows once the CF is ready I might just add 1 or 2 designs of my own. In the meantime I'm off to play the remaining cources that I've downloaded in rainy old Blighty.  Highly recommended.

review:
(Just wanted to add that JNPG advertises "cross platform play" on the steam store page, but this does not exist. It is "planned" for the Windows 10 version. Don't bother with buying this game. This is just another example of how the devs lie whenever possible. They said 2 years ago that career mode would be out "soon." Don't trust them. TGC2 looks way better anyways.)

Plays a good game of golf (except the putting is completely stupid), has hyper realistic coureses, and the course editor is easy to use, so many skilled disigners have gone all out on user created courses. These are the only good things about the game.

The player base is too small to have a proper online game, and the devs can only be bothered to update the in-game tournies every month or two. To play other tourneys, you need to register on one of two fan-created sites, one of which requires you to pay yearly dues. 

To see your stats, you have to go to the PP website and the format is trash. There are no in-game stats. 

There is no single player besides playing individual rounds. No career, no tournaments, and the AI golfers derp more than not.

If this game was actually completed, I would recommend it. 

Now they are talking about making a "new" version and will stop updating this one. I say "new" version, because what they are doing is moving this same game with some additions (supossedly) to the windows store. They are doing this so the few users they have left will have to pay for the game again to get the updates while not paying Jack Nicklaus for the use of his name again.

This review is sad because this game has potential, but like many other games with "potential," the devs of this are DBag liars and are just trying to milk their few users for as much as possible. 

Mike can make a good course, but that seems to be all he knows how to do.
