review:
Have been part of the EA for this game since it started and have seen the game develop over time.

Having been lucky enough to be part of the private beta group, I have seen how comitted the small team of developers really are as they strive to give us the best virtual golf experience possible. Well IMO they are certainly well on the way. 

Work continues to keep adding and updating, but what is already available:- varition of skill levels and assists, various swing modes already available (with more being worked on), multiple methods of gameplay, solo or multiplayer, variable weather options, great graphics and sounds, real time ball flight physics and smooth gameplay, for any true virtual golf fan, this title is well worthy of a place in your golf game library.

With only older versions of the Links and TW series still available on PC, virtual golfers were crying out for something to replace them. Well for me, Perfect Golf is definitely one of the current available option worth taking a look at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127402574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4559, 'last_played': 1661967605}
review:
Well after having played Perfect Golf for a few weeks ( 75 hrs ) now I figured I would give my review of how the game is and stands currently. This game is still in the Pre release stage (10/15) and updating gameplay and features.  I have played all the courses and used the different settings and features.  

With just a standard mouse $7 cheapo the game plays pretty good and has the overall feel of golfing on the course. You can play 3 Click or with Mouse swing currently. The courses they have so far are really nice and some you will be able to remember seeing before as they are real PGA golf courses. Scoring was not too bad, it does depend on the level you play with and how well you can do with the controls on the system you have. I managed to break par on beginner, but Pro level has still kept me over par.

There is a gameroom and multiplayer to find matches. They have also just introduced AI golfers that you can set up to play matches with you as well.  There are several different gameplay options like strokeplay, skins, matchplay, etc.. You can change the weather, wind, stimp of the greens, tees. and other settings to increase difficulty.

A Course Designer is coming called The Course Forge that really looks nice.  It does need to be used with Unity to lay out the Base Terrain. After you make your initial terrain you would use the CF to apply the different fairways, greens, bunkers, distances, tees, course objects, etc....

If you are looking for a Golf Game that gives you a challenge and feels like playing golf I would say go for it. 

Perfect Golf will make you think twice about how your are going to play that next shot.

The quiet intensity of the game is being captured for sure. There are many skill adjustments so all are challenged.  Online play: I just played a game and it was smooth with two of us.  He was on PC, I am on MAC.  Looking forward to being able to edit the players "look" and the other improves that are coming.   Now: if I can just get my sons to buy it! author: {'steamid': '76561198127064928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3524, 'last_played': 1464110852}
review:
EDIT 3/30/16

I write this about 5 months after my initial review. The game is playing much better these days. Find myself trying to get a round in almost every day. Maybe the time away and the updates when I booted up after some time off did the trick. I run on a pretty quality system so I don't know if system quality (or lack thereof) explained the earlier issues. All that aside, it is running pretty smooth now. I'm starting to really enjoy it again. I have a few gripes but they're pretty minor. Would like to control spin more, especially on wedge shots. Can't seem to get legitimate back spin ever. That said, I love the challenge this game takes to shoot a solid score. 

At this point, I'd really like to see the accessibility to the other features of the game get easier. I don't have any steam "friends" who play the game so I can never get in on any multiplayer matches. Would be really nice if the companion site became a great resource for players of the game. I would love to enter more tournaments, access a "career mode" (I don't think that game mode is available yet), etc. Also, I have no idea how to download all these courses that I'm seeing people play on. Games like "Banished" have a simple subscription model for mods and additions to the game. I can't figure out how to add those for this game. This could very well be a case of my own ignorance. 

All in all, I'm changing my review to favorable from initially negative. Could be an awesome game in due time. Hopefully sooner than later!


(Original Review Below)

I can't seem to get this game to work. I bought it a long time ago from the early access and as far as I can tell the game has just gotten worse and it has been awhile since the release. I now can't even find a resolution acceptable enough in the graphics option for the game to work. Set the resolution too high, and the game is insanely laggy. Completely unplayable. Set the resolution to low and it's accompanied with a bunch of bugs. As I click the meter, the screen switches from wide screen zoom to regular, and then after I finish the swing, it goes completely black for a few seconds. Disappointed in the evolution of the game from the beginning. Best to focus only on smooth gameplay, and build from that. It seems the dev team has tried to add random features that really have never come to fruition and somehow they've compromised the quality of play along the way... Valiant effort. Still can be recovered I guess but we'll see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056222129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 205464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121007, 'last_played': 1670257307}
review:
Updated review

Rating 1-10

Realism = 10
Graphics, physics and RTS and you feel like your on the course. Just set the difficulty level to match your real game or lower it to beat the real Pros. If your a masochist just play Tour Pro and Real time swing but be prepared to shoot a higher score then you do in real life. I'm not sure the RTS Tour Pro level can ever be mastered, but time will tell.

Graphics = 9.5
Color and textures are awesome, Other then walking out my back door to the course i believe it's as close as you can get.

Physics = 9
It has varied quite a bit over the updates and it's just getting better

Swing types = 10 
Three click, Motion Swing is awesome, Real Time Swing just added and love it, it brings me to my real game of golf. 

Game play = 6-9 
Varies due to updates and working bugs out each update, which is pretty timely and usually the same day for a major bug on new update release day. Swing difficulty options are numerous and you can adjust as you progress. Career mode upcoming and Season of play at off sites (OnlineGolfTour.net). Community small but growing. Shift WASD Key for shot setup would be great one day. Icon next to player to verify swing type or filter to allow only certain swing types. I get some game freezes and disconnects at times, but again early access. Older end pc's may have some issues on Higher graphic settings. With all that PG is my game of choice

Course Quality = 9 
Colors and textures are very nice. Older end pc's may have some issues on Higher graphic settings. 

Course Creation = 6
Just improved with last update and seem to be rolling out for user created courses of Beta Course Forge. Full release of Course Forge Pending and untried by me personally.

Player ANI = 6
Work in progress, clothing options just added. Equipment updates are in the works

Compared to other Golf games, the Best out there if you want the actual feel of playing golf in motion swing or Real Time Swing. 

Early Access its a bargain and it's only getting better, for some it can be frustrating with updates and working through bug issues. For $20 my playtime in game is down to 1 cent per hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981077694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1451835390}
review:
I have been looking for a realistic golf game to play with multiplayer that wasn't chalked full of gimmicky items or horrible game mechanics. While this game is in early development and lacks a lot of polish and shine it does have a very solid core design that can project it to be a powerhouse as sport sim game. I will give a direct pro/cons list for easy navigating.

Pros:
-Realistic ball physics
-Nuances of real golf
-Innovative swing design and a familiar classic 
-Great community
-Active Devs
-Actively works with the PGA

Cons:
-Multiplayer needs to be sped up
-UI is clean and tidy but parts feel clunky not well explained (keep in mind early access/development)
-Player customization is coming but not yet here

Some of the cons are being addressed by the devs but since they aren't in game yet they will remain in cons. Been burned by too many other game developers to be positive about upcoming changes until they are already in game.

Overall very promising game, Already have a few friends and family that picked it up. I will be spending a good chunk of my gaming time playing Perfect Golf. Def would recommend to people looking for a realistic golf sim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002621482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 24446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6615, 'last_played': 1597169756}
review:
Before buying this game please make sure that you understand that this game is still pretty much in early access, and there will be bugs etc., so it’s far from perfect in its current state. However if you want to help in its development then this is the perfect time to buy it. This game as a golf sim has so much potential and can be very challenging if you turn all the aids off. There are patches been applied, but because it’s a small development team they are few and far between. The graphics leave much to be desired, considering its 2015, the graphics are reminiscent of a game released in the late 90’s, I am sure that will also be improved in time.
There are currently only a few limited courses, unlike TGC (The Golf Club, by HB Studios) there is no course creator, so there are no community submitted courses to play on, which is a real shame as it’s something that would attract more players to this game.  This game has been developed for PC and I think it’s due for release on the consoles too.
It's now been several months on since this game was released. Its had many patchs which has improved this game even more. The graphics are still retro, but there is talk of improving this soon. As far as golf sim's go, then there is nothing out there that gets close to it. The game play is really solid and improves with each patch released.
The introduction of AI and the horizontal swing meter has in my opinion improved this game even better. The AI still needs some tweaking, but it's great to play against the computer, and you can also adjust the AI's skill level.
As I've mentioned before this is the only true golf sim out there, so a lot of practice is required if you want to play this game well.
Is it worth the price?..Hell yes, if you love golf, then make sure you have this in your bag. The introduction of an editor will soon make this a better game to play....

author: {'steamid': '76561198242949766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1501545165}
review: I've played golf games since the mid-early 90's (Links) and leading modern titles like Tiger Woods Golf and Perfect Golf is among the best of them. What is amazing is this game is 'early access' and yet is still capivating to play, despite the rough edges which will, no doubt, be smoothed out as the game development progresses. Top impressions include: stunning procedural computer graphics (my machine is Apple iMac w/ i5 CPU) and the best golf physics engine I've seen on a game ever. Like real golf, Perfect Golf isn't easy. You won't be breaking par anytime soon, and perhaps ever if you turn off all the "aids" and tackle the courses at the hardest settings levels. I'm a former 3 handicapper and take my real golf seriously. There are no gizmos and fake PGA tour galleries...just great, accurate physics simulated golf. This is good virtual training for good real golfers and will help you hone your 'course management' skills. One last point, at some point users will be able to tap PerfectForge and design their own courses with a tool that is much more professional and capable than the Greg Norman Course Designer at The Golf Club game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964419162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5793, 'last_played': 1497928273}
review:
A great game for anyone who wants a bit more depth and difficulty in their golf. There's a real challenge in keeping your shots straight and hitting the greens with right amount of roll. There's also a tempo-based motion swing available that has a lot of depth and a somewhat steep learning curve. It's difficult but fair, and it's a lot more fun (for me) than the traditional 3-click meter, which is also available.

Because it is still in early access, there are a few bugs and rough edges, but these are slowly being worked out. It's a blast to play even now, and well worth the measly 20 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960949119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1437964289}
review:
I'm physically handicapped, so I need simply controlled games.  No fps's, fast rts's or sports games, just click and click some more.  This is perfect in that regard.  Unfortunately though, whie easy to play, the graphics are painfully dull and the ambiance needs work.  If you're going to stare at the screen at least make the textures detailed or the models more defined.  The default character golfer is pretty low poly, now whether that's a design decision because they're using Unity, I don't know, but I've seen higher poly assets in other games on the same platform.  There's not much in terms of default animation with the golfer either, not that he should scratch himself with the putter, but like other games, whn you're lining up a shot you move or adjust your positions from looking at the hole, crouching to line things up and then finally taking the shot.  The scenery as I said, the ambiance needs work.  Skies, clouds, birds, water, grass and shrubbery, all just sits with a simple state to move a bit.  Just small amounts of movement.  I'm not asking for somebody to throw a pie, but if it's going to be a pc game, put some graphical power behind it.  I maxed the graphics, but still, nohing cool besides maybe a lens flare, but lens flares aren't cool...so here we are.  

Gameplay, yeah there's multiplayer and you can set up games with friends, but that's standard these days.  No silly side games or practice shooting in a range.  Just dive in and it's pretty shallow.

I bought this for a twenty but that's a bit much, had I known what to expect I'd say it's maybe worth a fiver.  I wouldn't mind a refund but I won't lie, it's easy to play and it'll be great when I'm drunk trying to kill time.  My standards tendt to lower.  

I'd say save your money for a bigger studio release.  Maybe get this if you love golf but if you can play whatever you like, unlike myself with a physical disability, dear lord buy something where you can kill stuff and destroy monsters.  Do it...do it for those who can't...do it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064122781', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 85127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13632, 'last_played': 1664016833}
review:
Remember that this sim is still in development so let's review what we got up to now....controller support needs to come quick now imo, gone are the days were i hunch over a pc desk, my computer is setup more like a console.  The game has had a recent major update and performance has increased hugely, i have gone from playing on low/medium to high/ultra a fantastic improvement. 
    Gameplay is now solid and realistic and has surpassed the golf club in the simulation department, the short game is exceptional.  putting is much much better now but still needs tweaking slightly imo, breaks can be dramatic and give the ball a sliding feel, better visuals on the golf ball like logos and visible dimples may help with this perception.
      All in all perfect golf is shaping into a classic golf title, throw in a workable career mode and will improve again, the acid test though will be controller support and how it performs, that i believe will make or break this game....updated for latest content....DO NOT listen to any negative comments regarding PG, this game is near perfect if you are a serious golf sim player, if you prefer a more arcade approach the the golf club may suit you better.  SO think carefully before purchase, sim or arcade, pg does everything right and nothing wrong and you will not find a bettter sim golf experience anywhere! Fantastic! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198110761608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 129494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65308, 'last_played': 1616533115}
review:
THE GOOD: 
It's a golf game... for those that enjoy the type of video golf game that isn't necessarily all about of the arcade elements from golf games of yore. Instead, this game is clearly aimed at being more of a golf simulation.

The game, bolstered by the course creator community, offers over 400 courses, including accurate renditions of popular course destinations from all over the globe; as well as, plenty of fictional courses.

Also, the game is basically one of only a few somewhat recent developer attempts at bringing a commercial golf game to market. So, there aren't a heck of a lot of other choices; and, it's admirable that the relatively small team of developers stuck with it for as long as they did.

The game now offers 3D grass, and reflective water... although it will cost some frames.

The game features elevation effects; which allow the ball to carry further at higher elevation.

The game features online multiplayer modes like stroke, match, alternate shot, skins, etc. There is also a Resume feature, for players that get inadvertently kicked from an ongoing multiplayer match.

The game features multiple swing types, from 3-click, to gamepad, and mouse swings, as well.

THE BAD:
The User Interface, particularly when attempting to navigate through the menus and the settings, is very clunky and frustrating for new users. There exists no tutorial, despite the entire piece of software being anything but user-friendly. 

The sound is occasionally intermittent, with the impact of golf shots oftentimes being completely missed.
 
The graphics and vegetation colors are a bit outdated. Although, with the new 3D grass, the game looks light-years better.

The physics engine needs improvements. The equipment power progression is not linear, and often produces highly irregular physics results.

The golfer avatar looks unfinished. The setup positions are largely incorrect, down to the backwards hand positioning. Also, the swing animation has a terrible hitch in it.

There is very little user customization, outside of selecting 14 clubs. Each and every user is required to use the same exact character. The only variation being, some basic shirt color adjustments.

The course downloading system is somewhat disorganized, causing users to have to download each course from unaffiliated websites; and then, manually extract each file individually into the correct game directory. There are no auto-course-updates either, which causes users to have different versions of courses, preventing a given grouping from going off.

The lobby itself is setup rather haphazardly, with inaccurate or incomplete references to player locations on various courses, based on misidentified hole numbers. As well, listings of multiplayer games take approximately 30 seconds to refresh, causing all sorts of issues when multiple players try to simultaneously join a game. This can be fixed by password-locking your game, if you already have all of the predetermined participating players waiting in the wings.

THE UGLY:
There is no moderation whatsoever in the lobby. So, some users have been known to get quite vulgar, while trolling the lobby and flaming others, without consequence.

Where there is moderation, in the forums, the developers have repeatedly attempted to muzzle legitimate criticisms, by regularly deleting posts featuring bug reports and physics gaffes.  

There have been ongoing issues with Gimmes; freezing up the game entirely... when hitting a par 3 tee shot that lands inside Gimme range. The Concede Hole button oftentimes causes the wrong player or team to win the hole; and the round cannot be continued from this bug.

There have been ongoing issues with multiplayer connectivity failing, due to excessive lag, which can cause undue stuttering while spectating another player's shots.

The lack of blending the various lengths of rough causes unnatural bulges, and shots will occasionally interact as if the golf ball were coming in contact with a street curb, as opposed to thick grass.

Another huge issue is the lack of smooth undulating surfaces on greens. There are jagged creases and geometric shapes with straight lines protruding from the ground on many of the greens, oftentimes causing the golf ball to veer off of its intended path, unnaturally.

The cart paths hover above the ground. The developer has stated this is intended, as it is apparently a workaround to another issue. How is that okay?

Occasionally, the golf ball will actually penetrate underneath the surface of the turf, warp underground, and pop back up above the surface. This bug destroys all immersion.

There are no official competitions; and, unaffiliated private ladders - like PGLS - are run by highly competitive fellow players that oftentimes participate in their own tour events, while setting up draconian rules, which don't always apply evenly, nor even to themselves. It ends up being a kangaroo tour, dictated by mob rule, and blind favoritism to users that fall within what is essentially just a tight-knit-friend-group.

In the end, the only fair methods of competition would be rated lobby games, and an official tour... run solely by the impartial developers.

OVERALL: 
Overall, the developers have definitely tried to make improvements to a whole host of game-breaking bugs. But, the game never took off, commercially; and it's very likely that the lack of commercial success contributed to the inability of the developers to fully flesh out all of the fundamental issues with the game.

I've played the game as long as I have, off and on, because I enjoy turn based Alternate Shot; which the other major video golf developer has failed to adequately deliver on.

Also, from getting involved in the Early Access betas, this community was excited to see what could be produced without all of the bureaucracy of a large developer like EA Sports, which had just gotten out of the video golf game business. 

Ultimately, this game never fully reached its potential. But, since the community still keeps relevant courses, occasionally I'll fire it up and play along during the majors, or other big events where the top players in the world gather.

Still, there cannot be an automatic excuse to give the game a glowing review for which it's ultimately not deserving of. There remain far too many bugs, as well as, physics anomalies, and the glaring lack of any competitive purpose, whatsoever; which would compel any avid golf fan to give any largely unfinished platform a thumbs down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228283280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1462755784}
review:
I really like Perfect Golf. It has the look and feel of the PGA Championship PC game that I used to play, but Perfect Golf has the advantage of a strong and growing on-line capability thanks to STEAM. I have just several minor complaints about the game. 

First, I wish that the wind was more of a factor in the game to make players think a little more about how to shape shots. Clever  players could then hit fades and draws on purpose to hold the ball against the wind, or use the wind more to move around dogleg corners depending on the situation.

Second, I don't believe that players are penalized enough when hitting into or out of the trees. I have seen many shots go right through the trees like they were thin air, when in real golf the tree limbs or leaves would have knocked the ball down. Fairway bunker shots also seem a little too easy compared to real golf.

Lastly, I suspect that some of the players out there that are using the Motion Plus method to swing the club are using a track or some other kind of aid to move their mouse perfectly each time. It's too much of a coincidence that they have the same shot shape everytime, especially when consistently hitting it with over 100% power. That creates an unfair advantage over those players who use the tri-click method. I recommend that you allow just the tri-click method for on-line play to guarantee that no player has an advantage over any other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075015538', 'num_games_owned': 932, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1473371532}
review:
Brutal at times, but rewarding.

Like others have said, clearly the best PC golf game available. Don't expect an EA Tiger Woods console experience and you will be fine. A lot of work left to be done, but hopefully it will improve with each update. At it's purest it provides a great multiplayer experience, you won't find any reason to play alone except maybe to adjust your difficulty or swing format. When you make a great shot you really do feel the same satisfaction as you might with a real round of golf. I've tried motion controls and minimum assists but it felt too similar to my real life golf game. Much more fun and still challenging with the 3-click and help. review: This isn't the best Golf simulator I have ever played that distinction goes to Tiger Woods the Masters on Wii but Perfect Golf is a decent one,  Some reviewers have made a comparison to the now defunct MS Links. I can see the comparison but this game in its current incarnation isn't quite as good as that game. I have also played The Golf Club and that one I would say is the more polished game if I were to compare it to this one. The control scheme is also completely different, this game gives you the choice of swinging with your mouse or using a three click system which is my prefered method of control for this game. As others have stated there are a limited number of golf courses to play on at the moment but the game is still a work in progress so I'm sure that will change over time. If you have a spare 20 bucks to blow I would give it a shot if you are looking for a PC or Mac golf game that is easy to pick up and play but hard to master.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010090410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1582585787}
review:
Im just giving a quick review on this game as of right now being that its still a early access game i will come back to this once more patches get implimented. Now that that is out of the way, im always keeping my eyes open for a good pc golf game as i am a avid golfer and a country club memeber so i take it fairly serious,(more about getting better outside of just having fun). The king of the course to this day still imop is the Links ls series. I was on the interwebs and caught drift of Perfect Golf, not sure if this was true but i had read a few of the older designers from the Links series helped out with either the production/direction or programing of this title. Right off the bat that sparked my intrest because i hold Links LS is such high regard. After getting to play this now for a bit heres my thoughts what i like and what can improve.

The graphics are pretty nice all things considering, i still need to really tweak the settings a bit yet. As for the performance its really hit and miss and i do hope down the road they OPTIMIZE this title a bit better.
Im expecting high framerates with my setup, (i7 4770k 4.4ghz, MSI GTX 980 4g, m100 ssd and 8 gigs of rip jaw x ddr3 1866). My fps fluctuate from 80 (caped) all the way down to 28 or 30. Even with everything maxed i feel this game should run at a steady 60fps no problems with my setup, so better Optimization would be a great addition.

I enjoy the ball flight and the way it behaves on the green;s (backspin/roll/ect) this is what i loved most about Links Ls and i would say Perfect golf gets this pretty close to what Links Ls had. No Tiger woods Bs where you can manipulate the ball spin in mid flight. The sound is good and animations are good minus the putting animation something bout short puts and how the golf holds the putter combined with the stroke seems a bit off to me.

Im sure this will be added down the road but Crowds for tournement play should be here also a variation of diviot animantions would be nice. Also i just thought of this but to coincide with the divots they should add an extra meter (pro difficulty) where you also have to gadge weather or not you have hit the ball clean/slight divot or hitting it fat, heavy divot, i would really like this added! 

Lastly this wil take some time but hopefully this game will get a strong and rich following and it will mature into what Links ls has in its Links Corner. With there course designer and obviously a ton of time, there are so many real course replicated in great detail that users are able to play. The catalog of courses is so extensive most of the time when the real world tourneys start up i would say 80 percent of the time there is that same course i can download and play will the pro's are actually playing them. Its deep golf nerd stuff but some what of a guilty pleasure i have and will play that course while my laptop plays the golf channel right next to my comptuer!

I would give this game Birde for right now. The drive is in the fairway with the approach shot was on the green but not to close followed by a 20 foot put that sink if your picking up what im throwing down. So far more hits then misses, can't wait for more updates from these developers keep up the good work and lets go for that eagle!

review:
Scroll down for my updated review I LIKE THIS MUCH MORE NOW. (old review) This is absulotely terrible! You can't make a game that looks sooo pretty but plays terribly. I have played every Links Golf Series, ive played PGA Tour on the Ipad, ive probably played every golf sim since the Atari 800 XL The control of the power bar is completely rediculous the swinginmg is way way way off. If you move your golfers position farther to the left and then take a swing and it misses the mark and goes just a little bit the ball curves to the left WAY WAY WAY left not equalling the strength and the way the ball should be going. The Physics are all wrong. The Mouse buttons to stop on the swingdown is not consistant and sometimes it does not respond ir it responds late and the swing goes way to the left or the right. Links 2003 a game that is 12 years old plays better than this game, it may not look as animated and as perty as this game but at least you can have fun playing the game. This being said this is still in BETA and Im really hoping this game improves cause wasting $20 doesnt make me a happy camper.

Also the swing is easier than i thought HOWEVER its way too sensitive sending the ball right or left even if your barey left or right of the downswing marker. I have a pretty good PC with lots of memory and 3 core etc the graphics are very choppy when set to best, so I lowered it and it playes great and even though its not on the highest settings it looks 420X better than LINKS, Tiger Woods etc.. I wish there were more sounds of people clapping , announce team etc..  Im upgrading my review rom above..

author: {'steamid': '76561198132025111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1435612685}
review:
Ok so this game is pretty fun for a golf game. There are only a few concerns that i can bring up that they need to fix.
1. Sometimes you can get your ball to bounce out of a bunker and as far as I know, bunkers aren't trampolines.
2. Putting power and the power system. There is a a line that is what is the recommended strength for the the putt but it says you may have to adjust yourself based on the incline/decline of the putting green. This is false. If you go above the line on average putts it doesn't change the power at all. Same goes for if you go below the line. Chips and bunker shots have the same kind of wonky thing happening. 
3. Wind. Wind seems to have little to no effect on the ball's trajectory even at 17-19 mph.
4. Your persons legs disappear when standing on an incline.
5. The in game sound is insanely loud, even when  you put everything at 4% of the 100% possible. For me, 1% is about perfect.
6. Ball spin. If you position the shot to where you get underneath the ball when you swing, backspin should accompany the shot as well as the shot going shorter than normal because it should increase the arc on the ball. No such thing happens. The ball goes farther and when it lands no backspin happens. Instead when you don't position it at all and just swing normally your ball will get this weird ghost backspin that happens for no reason. Topsin has a similar effect where the ball doesn't change trajectory at all other than it flys shorter than normal. No ball spin happens when it lands as well.

If they can touch up a few of these mechanics they have in the game but have no effect on it then this game will literally be perfect golf. Except for like, real golf...

author: {'steamid': '76561198178987635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1448459855}
review:
Terrible!

It's not a golf game, it's a shell of a golf game with no internals. There is no AI, no season/career options, no stats, no tournament play. You can play a round against yourself or an online opponent and that's it! Graphics are average but it does however still require serious PC juice to run. Menus are few because there are no real features that require menus. Visually the menus have a very simplistic layout and are certainly not intuitive to navigate. There are no great new features in Perfect Golf that other golf games don't have. The features it does have are nothing new and are extremely basic with many bugs/issues.

You would think the developers would do something great with one of the most important areas of any golf game, the swing meter! Well, no, it's as basic as you can get! 
I like to click. You have some very basic difficulty settings you can adjust for the game difficulty and that's the end of the swing meter feature list. There is no option to change the swing meter speed to something of your liking. There is no option to add markers to the meter. The meter links to the graphics engine so if you don't have a silky smooth running game, you also won't have a silky smooth meter making it impossible to play. These are simple meter options golf games over a decade old provided. Perfect Golf gives you the most simplistic of meters with virtually no options to tailor it. 
If you use the mouse method for swing, same deal, extremely basic with little to no control. There is not even a horizontal mouse swing option! There is no feedback on how well you did with your swing as in Tiger Woods games so you never know what area of your swing needs work.

Considering how little of a golf sim Perfect Golf provides, you would think the developers would nail what has been done before in golf games and improve upon those features. No such luck! Here we have first time developers and it shows in every bland detail of the game! 

One final example to leave you with. The game contains a follow the ball in flight option same as a ball-cam from the Tiger Woods games. In Tiger Woods the camera follows the ball through flight and as it hits the ground the camera smoothly follows behind the ball as it bounces and comes to a stop. In Perfect Golf, as the ball hits the ground, the camera bounces along with the ball! The entire screen jumps up and down. Talk about annoying! Talk about motion sickness! Talk about the feeling you are playing arcade golf! You find youself expecting the golf ball to explode or some dude to come out from behind a tree and start shooting at you every time your shot hits the deck!

It's an early access game but it's not too difficult to see a game that no amount of time and patching will help ever become a good one. Complete waste of money and time!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963682238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1490490796}
review:
This IS NOT Tiger Woods, and it doesnt promise to be. 

The lack of controller support makes the game completely unplayable from your couch. This is a golf SIM, not a casual golf game. If you attempt to use your mouse with motion swing, your ball will fly left every time. The graphics are sub-par at best which is unfortunate. 

If you have played golf games before, this one is VERY easy to pick up and start playing. Very simplistic. I didnt want another Tiger Woods game. I was however, hoping that some of the positives that made those games so much fun would be incorporated in this. Who knows, its early access. I hope the DEVS have everyone in mind while making this game. Not just the die had golfer, but the casual gamer/EA fans as well. 

Controller support would go a long way in making this game more fun, lets get that done quick. Looking forward to seeing the completed game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063398291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7522, 'last_played': 1459368993}
review:
Hands down the best golf simulation ever created. Things that seperates itself from other games:

-A real time physics engine combined with real ball flight data(launch angles, spin rates and ball speeds) taken from launch monitors put this game in a class of it's own. Once you experience the before mentioned there really is no going back to other golf games.

-The Motion Swing mouse mechanic is a first of it's kind that introduces D plane swing theory. What is D plane theory and how does it realate to the mouse? Well, the simplified answer is the tracking of the actual swing path plus the tracking of the clubface angle. Your swing path is determined by the direction you move the mouse and the clubface angle is determined by the tempo at which you move your mouse.

-A real time weather and lighting system allow you to input a geographic location and play in those weather and lighting conditions. Never before has a golf game recreated weather and lighting conditions like this game. The lighting and shadow effects are exceptional and really change the look and feel of a course. You can even play in a thunder and lightning storm. Even though you wouldn't do this in real life it's worth doing in PG just to see the lightning effects.

-The last thing worth mentioning, and maybe the most important is, this may be the first game to offer up realistic scores in competition. I see no way to shoot in the 50's on a consistent basis, especially with aids turned off. I see scores being very close to real life, maybe even higher. Since tempo plays such a high role in the swing, straight edging or trying to zero out the x axis on the mouse is not going to get your far. Also, since the game uses a real time physics engine to determine spin you can't put artificial spin on the ball and throw darts at every flag.

$20 for this game is a steal. Buying it now will save you $10 to $15 when it goes retail. Once the course forge is released with the retail version and courses start pouring in, there will be no reason to even talk about another golf game. The potential this game has is limitless. If done right, this could be one of the greatest sports sims ever created.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207434868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4138, 'last_played': 1520308613}
review:
Well 58 hours into this game and I am surprised and delighted with it, an exceptional program for a test release.

I was a Tiger Woods player from the very first and enjoyed each version and I have a strong liking to the three click swing meter.

I think many who do not like this game are still committed to the unusually low scores attainable in the TW range. Even I had my 15/20 under par rounds at St. Andrews. 

The swing meter has sever punishment for a pulled or pushed shot, but this only encourages me to take more care on the third click.

I have only played the easier settings but the wind seems to have little effect on the flight of the ball.

At times the roll seems excessive especially on the fairway slopes.

The graphics and ambient surround sound have an exceptional quality.

I have experienced two bugs, one irrelevant and the other annoying.
(a) : At times the lower half of the players legs disappear in the bunker.
(b) : The program freezes after a final putt is made and there is noway to restart the program or PC except to reboot. When the PC is rebooted the game continues from where it froze. This has happened on about six games to date.

I am convinced that if this program continues and expands as it has begun it will be an extremely addictive game to play.

Anticipating the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135378483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1443728613}
review:
First, let me say that the gameplay and interface have overall left me with a very positive impression. As regards the gameplay in particular, it is indeed excellent, although even at the easiest setting the shot meter is very unforgiving. A slight miss off the center line, left or right, yields an erring shot in no man's land. So you better hone your reflexes. That caveat notwithstanding, the game is great fun. Kudos to the developers at this stage of development.

Now, on the less positive side: the graphics are nice, but a bit disappointing, if we consider that they are roughly on par with the graphics in the game Links 2003. I must say, however, that I am here comparing the best and most recent offerings of this old game, with respect to available courses, and the likes of Shardowlands in Perfect Golf. Still I find that the vegetation, especially the foliage of leafy trees, could and should be better, more polished and photo realistic. I would likewise welcome some flowers in places to add a touch of color and variety to this green fest. Also, even with the antialiasing on, there are still some noticeable jagged edges. Keep in mind that I have the graphical settings at ultra high, with max resolution of 1440 P. In short, I believe there is still work to be done on the part of the developers when it comes to graphics.

Clearly, and quite predictably at this stage, there is also a lot of work to be done when It comes to available courses, clubs, and avatars. Furthermore, I would love to see an array of AI opponents of different skill levels for off-line games.

I suggest Perfect Parallel include a store in the game to give the option of considerably expanding the content at a reasonable cost. I personally have no issue with financially rewarding the developers (like the competent course designer Mike Jones) for this most promising game. Yes, I am hooked, albeit with some reservations at the present time. I am truly burning with anticipation, thinking of what is to follow for us golf lovers. 

Let us hope for the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970799745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1546808995}
review:
First off, a big thanks to the devs on bringing us this Early Access version of Perfect Golf. I'm running the game in windowed mode 1280x768 on a 5 year old laptop with AA on and Bloom on. Trees are set at 350, shadows 200, Grass 100 and camera view distance 1500. All things considered the game runs good apart from a few stutters here and there that I can live with and haven't yet affected the playability.

Ball Physics: the team has done a wonderful job on the ball physics, especially after the latest update. I considered the ball physics in Links v1.07 to be one of the best I've seen in a golf game but in PG they've taken it to another level of realism. Sure, there is still some work to be done but having played a few different golf games this is the best I've experienced as yet .......

BUT .... while I feel that tee to green the devs have created up to now the best simulation of real golf yet seen in a computer game, I do feel an element of realism is then lost with the putting model. To help explain this I should point out I am a novice real life golfer, having only played the game for around 18 months. So it is fresh in my mind what it is like to be a beginner and having to learn the game. I feel a simulation should have the same sort of difficulties and learning curve with all aids off as the real thing. That may also mean I'll never be able to shoot under par for a round as in real life. A par on a hole should feel like an achievement. Unfortunately the putting model destroys this sense of achievement because it feels like I have too much help. Sometimes I misjudge my long putts on a real course massively - and that never seems to happen to me in PG due to the putting meter. And sometimes in real life I've putted from the fairway just off the green and given too much power and ended up off the other side of the green. I can't seem to do that in PG as my power is limited by the meter.

My suggestion - a straight swing bar that follows the movement of the mouse. The putter head placed two thirds down the bar with movement then for back swing and power and length of follow through for movement. Putting aids can be markings on the bar to help judge distance but true simulation mode with no aids would be with no markings and just from feel as in real golf. Don't know if something like this is possible. It would mean that by selecting a putter the graphic would automatically switch from an arcing swing meter to a straight putting bar. In simulation mode full back swing (of course restricted to a point) and full, fast follow through would always result in a maximum power putt.

A free roam mode would be nice, even if it was only restricted to a 20 or 30 yard zone around the golfers position, to allow for better planning of shots like in real golf when views are restricted. Of course, these restricted views should also be set to golfers eye level for realism.

Look forward to future update improvements and hopefully more courses. Great job so far and the closest to a simulation of the game I've yet to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035156249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1689412230}
review:
I've been playing golf and computer games for about 25 years now, ever since I was about seven years old, so I feel reasonably qualified to comment on something that combines the two.

The early access of Perfect Golf is a fantastic start and the devs appear to have every motivation to bring the game to full fruition. Unlike many early access titles, the devs at Perfect Golf aren't promising heaven and earth just to get people's money but they are promising to create a great golf sim for real golfers, something I firmly believe they are very capable of delivering.

The current basic build is solid and enjoyable enough to hint at what is to come. Of course it has some bugs and it is missing many features and some areas require polish but these are all being identified and dealt with systematically and professionally as far as I can tell.

For anyone looking to buy this game in its current form, note that it does not yet have the following features which some may want to wait for:

- Computer opponents
- Career mode
- Golfer appearance customisation
- Statistics and Tracking

I would also say that, while the game looks very nice on my machine in ultra high detail at 1080p (you need a proper gaming graphics card here by the way), the golfer animation could be doing with being more fluid and the feeling more solid when the ball is struck or impacts the turf. It just feels a little floaty at this point with the golfer, terrain and ball all having a slightly disconnected feel. Additionally, the wind conditions seem to have no effect on the trees or flag; at 50mph the trees move identically to when the wind is at 10mph.

On the other hand, the in flight ball physics are awesome and the mouse control "motionswing" mechanic is brilliant and is easily the closest feel to a real golf swing that I've experienced in a PC golf game. This mechanism puts the onus on the tempo and rhythm of your swing rather than just how straight you can move the mouse back and through (anyone remember table edging?). Downswing too fast and the ball is going left, too slow and it's going right, similar to real golf. If you let the pressure get to you and you lose your tempo, you're in trouble, just like real golf.

Also, the real time weather and sky conditions make everything feel a lot more realistic and help with immersion.

At this point there are no computer opponents and no sort of career mode but these are planned. Additionally, there is no golfer or gear customisation beyond being able to select which 14 clubs you want in your bag.

If you are a new starter (or even if you're not), here are my top ten tips for bringing down your scoring and increasing your enjoyment of the game:

1) go to options and change the camera to track your shot because it's a static camera by default which is boring
2) bring up the map using the button on the top right of the screen to allow for easier aiming
3) right clicking in the power circle allows you to change club and select normal or chip shot type
4) right clicking again in the power circle allows you to alter the trajectory or add fade/draw bias
5) read the instructions and practice with motionswing. It may be tough to start with but it's worth it when it clicks!
6) The marker on the putting green has nothing to do with power, only direction. The centre point on the putting power bar is the power needed to reach the hole on a flat green. You need to go past this point if you want to putt uphill
7) activate the terrain slope graphics for normal shots as well as putts because the ball being above or below the feet will send the ball left or right respectively
8) wind seems to have smaller effects on the ball than in other golf games but once the speed goes above 20mph it starts to have more of an impact
9) go into your golfer settings and swap something out for a 64deg wedge. This is easily the most useful club in the bag behind the driver and the putter
10) if you want to chat in a multiplayer game, hit enter

As far as multiplayer goes, it is currently based on a peer to peer hosting system with the normal modes of play you would expect and a few unusual ones. Since there is no central server yet you need to ensure you have a fast and stable internet connection if you are going to host a game. Otherwise, ask someone with a better connection to be the host. My experiences have been mostly positive as both host and guest with no disconnections but perhaps I have been lucky with my opponents.

From memory I think there are 6 courses currently to choose from and new ones are being added regularly as part of the updates.

If you are a fan of golf and you are looking for a proper golf simulator you should buy this game now.

If you enjoy golf games in general but want a career mode, customisable equipment and computer opponents, check back in 6-12 months.

If you want to pretend you are a superhuman who can drive the ball 400 yards and impart spin with the power of your mind, go play Tiger Woods.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970697215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 67991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 211, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1712260170}
review:
I've been playing this since day 1 of release and I can honestly say that it's the closest thing to real life golf you can currently get on PC.

The motion swing alone provides a level of control that will be hard to beat and when you add-in the great courses and multiplayer you get a PC golf experience that promises fantastic things.

Yes it's early access and there are plenty of issues to iron out, elements to add-in and areas to generally improve upon but if it this early glimpse is what we have to judge it by, the guys at Perfect Parallel will have a winner on their hands.

If you're in any way interested in PC golf, grab yourself a copy at the early access price and enjoy the ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175322193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1682005938}
review:
The best looking golf sim I've ever seen and a blast to play.... coming over from Links, it's taken all of the things I loved about the look and feel of that game and improved upon it - the course textures look and play similar, but now we have daylight, better shadows, moving water and plants, weather effects. I'm happy with the ball physics so far and the difficulty level is not overwhelming to start. 

Obviously some things in early access are limited, like the lack of courses and customization, but the beauty is that the developers of the game are open to almost any suggestion and are always out to improve the product. When this game brings about some of those features and also brings in the course design program to allow an unlimited amount of user created content - the sky will be the limit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020921666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1570079556}
review:
I'm sure others have many more hours in this then I do but, speaking for myself, I was looking for a decent Golf game I could jump right into, looked pretty good (not too worried about trees swaying), was easy to learn, tough to play and hard to master, this pretty much filled that bill, even in it's current state.

The game offers a learning stage where you can judge distances of your shots, make notes and have them be effective when you go to play some holes. I have not tried online yet because I don't think I'm that good yet but from the folks I've talked to in the Lobby Chat (yes, there is a chat room built in) it seems pretty good most of the time, and at this early stage, that's not bad at all.

I have to give this a thumbs up, I tried another golf game on here and gave up because just making a shot was like rocket science, this one has you going in minutes with no problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065608830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 85692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18018, 'last_played': 1668275653}
review:
Played a lot of golf games over the years and this is simply the best yet.

Ball physics are excellent, the courses look beautiful and bearing in mind this is early access the small development team have been really helpful and are always present on the forums.

Motion Swing using the mouse is the best swing method I've ever used becasue it is all about 'feel' and that is what real golf is about also. There are loads of options for people who want a less challenging experience too...but playing with no assists is best imo. 

The game will be packaged with CourseForge for creating user courses and having been fortunate to have a dabble I can say it is a wonderful piece of software, way more versatile than TGC's offering.

The game is in Early Access...so it isn't the finished article just yet. But in the 6 months I have had Perfect Golf I have played 300 hours and enjoyed the regular updates. There are 10 great courses included...hopefully the real ones will eventually be licensed. 

Also worth mentioning is that Perfect Parallel do the graphics for Sky Sports golf. When you play, for example, TPC Boston in game (Massachusettes CC) you are playing the course as represented in Sky's golf coverage. I think thats a pretty cool thing myself. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119948433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 36154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1643203188}
review:
Having played golf games for absolutely years, it's a really pleasant change to play something that feels like a simulator rather than the type of arcade thing that Tiger Woods has turned into.

Playing Perfect Golf reminds me of Links and also PGA Championship - another old game that used the mouse (although that system was a bit flawed).

The new swing model of Perfect Golf is genuinely good - it'll take you a bit of practice to get it, but what I like is that you can hit quite alot of decent shots (neither truly awful or perfect) that makes the game feel more like the real thing. 

I've only been playing it for the past few days, and my gripe is about  some of the graphics performance - it's pretty stuttery even with a Radeon HD7770, latest drivers and 8GB ram. But reading some of the other comments that may be just something about the latest release (it doesn't get any better using the lower graphics settings either). Otherwise, the courses look beautiful.

I hope they keep up the good work on Perfect Golf - there's every chance it'll develop into the type of golf sim that's been simply non-existant for PC owners.

review:
Haven't played a golf game in quite a while. Although used to play the Links games a lot, which this reminded me of. It looks lovely and offers what I always wanted in a golf game visually and physically.

Little things like the player model clipping through severe slopes and clubs not being obviously accessible can be overlooked at this stage because the core of the game works well enough. There were very minor visual things that actually bothered me. The courses look wonderful, and the ball physics are pretty close to spot on which swayed me to buy it. My only real gripe is I'd like a fixed player camera, having the camera zoom in on the ball after impact gets a bit annoying after every shot.

Right now I'd recommend it because if this turns out to have its own easy to use course editor/creator, and has all of the important tweaks and suggestions addressed, then right now for a golf sim, it is a total steal. Looking forward to seeing what comes from this!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962286276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1705884406}
review:
I'm a big fan of the Early Access model. It gives indie game developers a chance to release games that enthusiasts will help test and report bugs + have the opportunity to request new features. This obviously tells me that the game is far from complete and the only way it's going to get better [no matter what state it's in] depends on the participation/involvement of the user base.

After having played Perfect Golf for a few hours it was clear to me that the skills of course design, that Mike, Andrew and the rest of the PP team have shown - time and again - in the courses they have released for Links 386, have been solidly brought forward to PG. The courses aren't just beautiful and difficult but the attention to detail is amazing. The live water, real-time weather, blend of grass etc. looks stunning and it makes the game very enjoyable. Although we currently only have 5 courses available, I'm enjoying every single minute of playing this game and helping to report back any issues I have found.

The areas of improvement that I see as most significant are 1) make online-play smooth for everybody 2) improve the clunky interface where we join and set-up games, etc. 3) make the ball physics a bit more realistic/tough when rolling around in the rough.

Features that I'm hoping will be added are 1) the ability to be able to create private games 2) the ability to see who is hosting/taking part in a game (Steam name) 3) the addition of a Break Line Indicator (similar to the one in Links).

This game is only going to get better and better and be a huge success. I'm actually building a brand spanking new PC, so I can enjoy the stunning graphics to its fullest:-)

Keep up the good work chaps!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059819272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1584080222}
review:
Pros: 
The graphics on Ultra High settings, look great. Of course, I only expect them to get better as development continues, and as the community gets ahold of the CourseForge to create custom courses.

As would be expected, the Early Access version of this game has some issues with the swing meters. However, I still feel that this game has a good foundation to build on with the current meters. Looking forward to the later builds to see what each swing meter feels like.

Also, the simple, in-game match making and chat is decent for an Early Access title. 

Cons:
There still seems to be a lot room for growth in this title. Most of the things I would say need to be fixed have already been touched on by other reviewers. However, I would have to differ in my opinion of the severity of the negative comments. I think that the main areas that will help improve the quality of this release are more player customization options, refined motion swing meter / character interaction, and more courses(...CourseForge).

Overall, I am happy with the quality for such an early version of what has the potential to be an amazing golf game. Like I said, I am truly excited about the release of CourseForge, as I believe it will add a great deal of value to this release. I think that some people expect more from Early Access titles, and may be a little harsh on the developers. I hope that they will be able to take the feedback they are receiving, and turn this game into the next big thing in golf simulation software.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047511517', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1535267213}
review:
Have been following this game for a while now.   The game, at this point, will not dazzle you with its graphics (I'm playing all graphics options maxed out, btw), but what it lacks in glitz, it makes up for with the truest golf mechanics and 'feel' that I've yet come across in a golf video game.    

I originally started out with the 3-click meter, because that's what I would normally default to after toying around with other games' motion swings (be it the Wiimote, PS controller or mouse).  However, after deciding to give this game's motion swing a try, I'm hooked.    Finally, a game that nails it.  The motion swing is fantastic.   It feels natural and organic, whether on the full swing, chipping or putting.    It's also deep, and difficult (playing with the assists at 'minimal') but with practice, you see improvement as you start to gain feel and muscle memory, just like in real golf.   The game also provides you with numerical feedback (on the driving range practice mode) to illustrate the errors and there is a guide on Steam that explains the numbers.  In short, there are 3 components - tempo, swing path and face contact, all determined by the speed and directions you move your mouse.  

The core game is solid.  Once they put some more spit and polish on this and throw in the course forge and other features, it may just be the definitive golf sim that people have been waiting forever for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975034122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3542, 'last_played': 1555248428}
review:
da bisher alle Reviews auf Englisch waren und ich aus eigener Erfahrung weiß dass es im deutschsprachigen Bereich auch sehr viele Fans von virtuellen Golfspielen gibt schreibe ich diese Rezension in meiner Muttersprache:

das Spiel erinnert optisch von Anfang an sehr stark an die Links LS Serie. Man könnte fast von einem "Klon" sprechen; Fans der Serie können also direkt und ohne Probleme loslegen. Leider betrifft dies aber auch die Grafik, die nicht auf dem heutigen Stand der Technik ist. Eine golftypische Musik läuft im Hintergrund ab (abstellbar); Vogelgezwitscher (auch abstellbar) begleitet meinen Weg. Ansonsten ist der Sound eher dürftig. Hier vermisse ich die kurzen Kommentare der Caddies ("bite!" oder "crushed that one") ebenso wie die Möglichkeit den Sound mit eigenen Dateien zu editieren. Auch das Geräusch beim Schlagen des Balles könnte satter und unterschiedlicher sein.

Nach dem Start finde ich mich im Chatraum wieder wo ich mich mit einem oder mehreren Spielern zu einer Runde Golf (Stroke, Match oder Skins) verabreden kann. Der Ablauf erinnert stark an die damalige MSN-Gaming-Zone oder Gamespy. Ich erstelle also meinen Charakter, bestimme die Auswahl der Schläger und stelle den Schwierigkeitsgrad ein. Hier gibt es zwei unterschiedliche Hilfsmöglichkeiten die ich frei einstellen kann: zum einen eine Spot-Verbreiterung auf dem sogenannten "Swing-Meter" (der Abschlagspunkt ist einfacher zu treffen) sowie eine Art Flughilfe (trifft man den Punkt nicht schmiert der Ball nicht zu stark nach links oder rechts ab). Nett: das Wetter lässt sich frei einstellen oder aber auch über eine "Echtzeit-Wetter" Funktion bestimmen.

Findet man sich dann alleine oder mit anderen auf einem (von fünf) virtuellen Golfplätzen wieder läuft eigentlich alles ab wie bei anderen Spielen dieser Art. Ein Schläger lässt sich sehr einfach auswählen (der Vorschlag des Caddies ist mit Vorsicht zu genießen). Flop, Fade etc. einstellen und ab dafür. Das Golf-Feeling kommt gut rüber; ein kleiner Chat erleichtert die Kommunikation (geht natürlich auch für die Tipp-Faulen über Skype oder TS3).

Irgendwann erreiche ich das Grün - und hier kommt es nun zu meinem Hauptkritikpunkt: der Swing-Meter zeigt nun ein kleines Fähnchen an das die Geschwindigkeit des Balles auf ebener Fläche zum Loch vorgibt. Es spielt also keine Rolle, ob man 2 Meter oder 20 Meter vom Loch entfernt ist. Einzige Schwierigkeit hierbei ist das Gefälle bzw. die Steigung einzuschätzen und den Grid, also das Gitter zur Bestimmung der Breaks auf dem Grün, richtig zu deuten, was Aufgrund der viel zu großen Breite der Gitterkästchen zu einem Glücksspiel mutiert. Nein, beim Putten kommt bei mir keine Freude auf.

Weitere Kritikpunkte sind das fehlen von Spielmodi wie "Best Ball" oder "Scramble". Es gibt nur einen (männlichen) Golfcharakter, keine Turniere, keinen Karriere-Modus und auch kein Ranking System. Die Ballphysik lässt hier und da zu Wünschen übrig und auch der Einfluss des Windes ist nicht wirklich immer erkennbar.

Trotz alledem empfehle ich dieses Produkt zum Kauf. Nach langer Zeit gibt es endlich wieder ein Golfspiel für den PC das in die riesigen Fußstapfen der Links LS Serie treten kann. Und da wir uns im "Early Access" Bereich befinden müsste vor all' meinen Kritikpunkten eigentlich ein dickes "noch" stehen, denn sie können alle noch ausgebessert werden. Ich hoffe einfach darauf, dass mich hier endlich wieder ein tolles Golfspiel erwartet. Der Ansatz ist zumindest mal vorhanden, und der sieht wirklich nicht schlecht aus!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965802201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 73919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58948, 'last_played': 1484256510}
review:
Perfect golf

 This early access offering from PP has funtionality,and the 

gameplay has been stable on my mid range Aurora R4. I have 

been impressed with the physics and ease of use. The options 

in this early release are also noteworthy and pretty much 

intuative.
 I have followed the devolpment of this game and was 

apprehensive as I loaded it up for the first time. I was 

pleasantly surprised as I played it more. Even at this stage, 

the options to set it to ones liking are plentiful and much 

more than the basic, bare bones state that other early access 

titles offer.
 Once you have started to become familiar with how your ball 

reacts to your input, the possibilities to try new shots or 

varying techniques is already engaging. I like a game that 

challenges me, and I feel PP has created something that can 

and will be honed and refined to what its customer base will 

suggest/request for future updates.
 The multiplayer functions well at this stage, with Steam 

friends/voice chat integration.   
 This early access includes only the base game but the Course 

Forge course designer will be included with the retail 

release. (There are many aspiring designers waiting to get 

their hands on that). 
 The PP website has tons more information regarding 

everything that is Perfect Parallel. The developers are very 

active in the forums and have shown they embrace community 

suggestions.
 I am a satisfied customer and see alot of potential with 

this sim-I am having a blast thusfar "feeling" this game, and 

look forward to its refinement. A definite "buy this" from 

me.


EDIT 3 March 2016-

Hundreds of hours spent growing with this sim and it has gotten better with age. The realism factor is amazing and the additions of wildlife, new swing methods and new options will satisfy anyone looking for a realistic golf simulation. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002337972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1656776446}
review: This is the 1st time I have ever felt the need to write a review of a game, but wow, been playing golf games since Leaderboard on the C64 30 odd years ago all the way through to TW14, and this is the best and most realistic simulation of golf I have ever come across (I also play golf). The courses are great and look realistic, ball flight and physics is pretty much spot on. You can tell a lot of hard work has gone into the making of this game, ensuring that it looks and feels like real golf. All thats really missing is a few more extras and a few more options, different avatars, maybe a career option in single player etc. But other then that, this game is almost there. 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198165868583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 135997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1676963833}
review:
Been waiting for this for some time and it was thoroughly worth the wait. Didn't have to spend a year to learn the game as you can be shooting in the seventies by the second round as I was. It is not easy from there. It shall be many months before I could claim a round average in the low seventies even playing on the easier of the two modes of operation and on the easiest of four settings within that mode. You will get value for money with this game as I see myself never mastering it. The quality of the courses I believe are of a very high standard, better than any other golf sim to date. The in flight ball physics are, in my opinion, near perfect.  Some other ball physics, not so good. Irregular bounce and bounce height need to be tweaked, ball travels too freely through heavy long grass, inconsistent spin on and around greens and ball holds on a bunker face. There is no lie indicator and once on the green the putting, in general, I found it to be a little easy. 

But it is early access and as it is with early access there is some work to do which the PP team are already at it. I have no doubt that the team behind this game have their hearts in it and in my opinion they are in this for the long haul, because of this I am unable to see this venture falling over. The game has huge potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174774997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19025, 'last_played': 1706036765}
review:
No idea how many different golf games I've played over the years, just say alot. This being an early release keep in mind the retail version will be much improved. I find the game very entertaining and highly addictive, motion swing is awesome, tried mouse swinging before and did not like it. 3 click swing works well also.

 While there are some things not quite perfected the game works extremely well, it's only major downfall is the horsepower required to run it (maxed out), I run it on the lower end graphics wise and it plays very smoothly, on the higher settings it looks fabulous but I get a tiny bit of lag. So if you love a good golf game that could become great, check it out now, it's cheaper.


Some 300 hrs later, this game is so worth 20 bucks. to many good things added since last year to mention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038030476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 444581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12575, 'last_played': 1707398001}
review: First virtual golf game I've been excited about since Links2003. Was fortunate enough to be involved in the beta testing of this game so I've seen it make progress by leaps and bounds over the last few months. Being it's an early access game it still has a few problems to work out but improvements are being implemented every week. Get in on the ground floor for a reduced price and enjoy the ride before it's "official" release date a few months down the road. Without a doubt the closest representation of a "real" round of golf out there. Various difficulty settings make it very playable for those new to PC golf games yet still allows those that are old pro's in virtual golf to rachet up the difficulty for a very very challenging round. Turn based multiplayer for up to 8 players on beautifull 3D hand crafted courses. This is the future of PC golf!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141805870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2015, 'last_played': 1459870964}
review: Be following this game and it's development for some time. When I heard it was coming out on Early Access I knew I had to pick it up. The more I play it the more I like it, I love the multiplayer lobby and being able to chat with other players during a round. There are a few things that need to be tweaked but PP is aware of what those are and are getting to them as fast as they can. It's a very good looking game and will get better and better as early access moves on towards the final release of the game. I know some say it's just an updated Links and maybe so but that's not a bad thing in my opinion. Looking forward to seeing this game progress, well done PP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057322817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 54520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8333, 'last_played': 1705095340}
review:
UPDATED 2-20-16
 To potential buyers, be warned that the developrs have askd for poeple to post reviews. So the flood of recent reviews stem from that request.

Even with the latest updates this game still has a long way too go. The RTS mouse swing isn't as good as PGA2k, TW series or CPG/WGC. It just has no feel, you have no idea what went wrong when the swing motion that just worked fine now sends your shot shanked off into the woods or a hazard. Ball physics are still unrealistic. This game is more frustrating to play than real golf a lot of the time. 
 I would love to say yeah buy it. But if you do just know there is still a ways to go yet.

Recommend this game? yes with a caveat. It is FAR from "Perfect" Golf. ball physics are terrible, putting is unrealistic, motion swing isn't real-time or tied to the golfer, wind has no effect, multiplayer has issues. Graphics are good (not as good as The Golf Club, better than World Golf Challenge 2011, the other 2 golf games I play).

The other caveat is to play this (and most new games) you'll need CPU and video card horsepower to run  it at high graphic settings. 

Basically this is Links 2003 updated to a 2009-ish game. If you like Links 2003 you'll really like PG. For those of us who like a golf game with a real-time mouse swing buy this early access release and see if the improvements over time make it better. $20 isn't a deal breaker. Right now I've stopped playing it and will try it again in a month or so to see if any improvements have been made.

UPDATE 8-13-16

many patches later this game still has issues. Latest patch introduces some "anti-cheat" into the software. So if you make a number of good swings the game says "must be cheating, using some outside swing aid on the mouse" and then will cause a mis-hit resulting in an errant shot. So you get penalized for honing a swing?!?
Ball physics still not realistic. Lob Wedge  shot lands, kicks forward?? no back spin? Yet out of the rough or sand ball checks up and spins back.
They really need to bring back the original programmers who initially did the game so the code that keeps getting broken with every patch can be fixed. but given so many have now worked on the code, it's probably really messed up for good and needs a complete rewrite.

So still can't recommend this game, just be aware of all the faults if you do decide to buy

author: {'steamid': '76561198005321637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1446244662}
review:
For Early Access it's an insight to how the game will play.  When things are added, and it is finally completed it will feel very competitive.  I am hoping we have character creation, as well as tournaments, or tours.  A levelling system would also be great, or some sort of handicap system.
