author: {'steamid': '76561198160456395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1547061416}
review: I have followed Perfect Golf for over two years and looked to participate in Kickstarter.  The release of EA finally arrived and I duly jumped and bought.  My initial reaction was one of regret because I couldn't achieve any level of gameplay.  Obviously my somewhat aged system was not up to the job.  Following advice posted around the forums I downgraded my graphic settings to minimum and suddenly I was playing the game.  My old eyes don't appreciate HD graphics so what I was seeing, looked fine to me.  What I'm trying to say is that I've needed to take the graphic demand to the minimum but am still finding a game I can play and learn.  Learning that there is little or no margin of error on the snap; the effect of moving the ball forward or backward in my stance; the influence of real time weather on the view of the game.  As an EA version of the game the potential seems massive and perhaps one day I may be able to afford a system to run it properly or perhaps I just need a new graphics card but in the meantime, I can still knock the ball into the water or the rough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962830851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1422305761}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090729902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 224237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 201, 'playtime_at_review': 6120, 'last_played': 1711892578}
review: I've been playing PC golf games for over 20 years and I have to say this is, bar none, the best golf sim I've yet to play.  Beautifully rendered golf courses are a pleasure for the eye but the real secret is what lies behind the surface.  Their use of real life physics in real time within the game creates a golf gaming experience that is unrivaled.  It is quite amazing how well it recreates the "feel" of golfing and that may well be the magic ingrediant that this game has.  Considering that this is early access it boggles my mind as to where the developers may take this game in the future.  If they keep this up, and I have no doubt they will, this game should become the gold standard in golf simulation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086360506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 133721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30625, 'last_played': 1669415194}
review:
I was waiting for a new Golf Sim since some years. After I gave up Links, which I still play once in a while, I was looking for something new, with a multiplayer function. I started playing Shot Online, TW08 and TWO, but non of these games really made me happy. When I heard about PG I was really excited. I followe their Forums since they have been active and now, after years of waiting, here it is. I was asked to join the closed alpha to test the game and helping to make this game the best game out there. I know we have a long way to go to make it the best Sim out there, but my experiences with the Dev Team and the way they do their fantastic Job, let's me be very optimistic, that we will soon have the best Golf Sim ever.

There are still bugs and glitches, but we are in Early Access, so noone should think he gets a finished product. But the game is playable and the numerous Options make it the game everyone wants to play. It now has 3-click and mouse swing (Motion swing) and more ways to play will arrive, like controller support. There are currently 5 courses but this will expand after final release as the CourseForge will be part of the Final. With course forge you will be able to create your own courses.

After all I think Perfect Golf is on the right way. There is alot of work to do, but the Dev Team works hard and I'm sure these guys are able to make this game the number 1 on the Online Golf market and maybe the best Golf Sim ever. As the game will always evolve there are almost no real limits in the future to add things.

Can't wait to see the "final" Product, but as stated, it will never be final.

Edit: 

Almost a year later this game really is awesome. New swing methods have been added, Controller support is added.

Are there still bugs or other issues? Hell yes!! But the developers are working hard and usually they fix those issues fast. Sure there are problems which take a lill longer to fix, but I'm very positive that most of them can and will be fixed soon.

What do you get for your money? You get a great Golf simulation. The game is fully playable, has alot of courses now that the Course Forge testers published some of their great works, you can play multiplayers with your friends and/or family. Some things still aren't included like a career mode and this is one of the things which will take longer to be implemented (After final release I guess) but the gaming experience is simply awesome.

Is the game finished yet? NO! And actually it never will be finished. The developers will always work on it and improve things. The game is still in Early Access, which meens it is not finished. There will be a final version soon, but even that will not be completely finished. So if you buy the game, all you need to do is enjoy playing it and sit back and wait for new features or graphics etc.

Update #2

6 Years later I wouldn't buy this game again in it's actual state. The Devs gave up the game some years ago, no new updates and the player base really gets smaller and smaller. The 3 click swings got worse and worse. No idea if this is a game problem, server problem or what ever, but missing the snap by 1/1000 mm ends up in a giant snap miss. When friends of mine miss the snap by a hair nothing really bad happens. My FIR got down from 84% Average to 23% Average. This is definatly not a problem of my swing as I don't miss the snap more than before. Maybe something activated the cheat-protection and never disabled it but I'm very unhappy with the game now. The devs never show up anywhere anymore. No comments no nothing. Time to move on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117833656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 29258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 17594, 'last_played': 1711748150}
review: This game began Early Access on or about January 2015 eventually they came out with the game they listened to a lot of the concerns of the early access people like myself. Some think they should have done more but here is the reality of this game. If you like a golf game that provides you the ability to create a course this is a great game for that;however, it is complicated to do so; however, it is doable and in addition because of its complexity you can do a whole lot with the course maker thing. Because of the PGLS website (google PGLS Golf) you have a great way to play multiplayer with tournaments a forum and people who beta test the course you make this website has basically saved this game. After awhile the developers focused on other things. If you like a realistic golf feel this is the only game that provides that. When you compare this game to other golf games that you think are great this game easily surpasses those with realism in addition you have many ways to play it meaning there is controller support and click or 3 click and motion swing and real time swing. I think putting in real time swing is horrible not sure how they could fix it and keep it realistic though. If you want different avatars and clothing opitions you are limited your golfer is a white male and the clothes are limited. If you like a whole bunch of different courses you have got it make. So for realism and course desighn this is the best thing out there and it is an embarrassment to the planet that it took past 2016 for this to happen and still all the other course designers are stupid and the mechanics too. The gaming golf community for the pc is so pathetic that many still play Tiger Woods 08 and Links 2003 then there is this the stuff in between is those is pathetic but thats my biased opinion. Fortunately these guys came out with this unfortunately life happens and they did not do a Career mode which was talked about they did not have different avatars ( so its a white guy and its male in this politically correct world this game will probably get banned because of this ) you can though make an AI golfer and play against it and tweak extensively its abilities. It will be a white guy who looks like you that wears different clothes unless you give them the same clothes. author: {'steamid': '76561198133673680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1519095196}
review:
Perfect golf has something that I just can't quite nail down.  All I can say is the more I play it, the more I like it.  At first I was not impressed.  The up close texures of the grass and rough were so bad that I almost gave up on it.....but I didn't.  I kept playing and have really enjoyed how the game plays.  The overall look has grown on me, especially since I figured out that I can change the time of day using the "dynamic sky" feature.  When I changed the time of day to evening it really made a big difference to me.  All of the sudden, slight elevation changes were more noticable and the shadows cast gave everything a more lifelike feel.  Being a golfer, the ball flight physics seem very realistic, although some tweaks are needed in certain areas which is to be expected in early access.

This game is still in "rough draft" form but I can see the potential for a really great golf game.  I hope the Developers have the time and are driven to make the necessary changes during this early access period because this game has the potential to be great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073754829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1476258023}
review:
As noted several times this is an early release game and shows great promise. Well done to the team at Perfect Parallel! Listen to your users and implement what is practical and achievable and a magnificent game will result. 
I did enjoy comments from another reviewer regarding the "emergent physics" used. If this is the differentiator to other golf sims then with further gameplay and feature development this has the potential to be better than the Green Jacket wearer of golf games being Links Golf.
Works well on my 18 month old MAC. A little "choppy" at times but still adjusting graphics settings to find the sweet spot.
I'm a keen golfer playing off 12 and much prefer the sim style of game, i.e. rounds of 65s - 80s and NOT the 50s you'd often see at the top of leaderboards on Links. Hopefully a blend of EA Tiger Woods (ease of play and visuals) and Links (gameplay and options) can be found.
Finally regarding the Course Forge tool. Agreed this will be a welcome addition to enable continued course development although BUT without a "perfect" gameplay experience the product will be lacking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066131786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 33252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2972, 'last_played': 1607008697}
review:
The game has huge potential and promise. Granted, the EA version has a few issues upon initial release but they are being caught by the new users and the Devs have a good list of things to work upon. That said, the game is beautifully playable offline and only limited today, by the online connections many games suffer from. It's best to begin offline anyway and play the game as it was made to be, a golf simulation. I wouldn't play a real golf course without learning how to hit a ball..!
 
The graphics on my 4yr old system run fine. I'd love to improve them, but to ensure the game runs with a good frame rate, I opted to keep the graphics down. However, the view is good, I have no tears or glitches and the screenshots I've taken look great. I can play the game at fullscreen in 1920 x 1080, so everything is as I expect.
 
Gameplay is almost spot on. It puts you in total control when playing using the 3 click system. The other control method is still being developed, so I'd expect that area to improve alot over the coming months. I won't comment any more on that, as I've not really tested it. This isn't like older or other golf games, it feels more Sim than Arcade. Granted it has a few elements that are needed to transfer anything simulated to a computer game, but they are minimal and necessary.
 
Real Time Weather is pretty cool, and works a treat. The Time of Day setting is one of my favourite things, being able to visually see the sun rising or setting, and playing a twilight game has the good old feel of those summer evenings, with time on your side. 
 
Currently the 5 courses are just about right. With the promise of many more to come, it will soon become a tough decision choosing what course to entangle yourself within. Plus of course the Course Forge (Designer) a little further down the road. 
 
I'd certainly like to see alot more improvements, walking the hole, first person perspective to name a basic few. However, reading the forums and discussions from the Dev's have made it clear these guys want to deliver something similar too. It feels like a winner to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966910965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 35500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1708786417}
review: Ce jeu de golf sera le digne successeur de Links 2003 si les développeurs se donnent la peine d'implémenter ce qui a déjà été fait en utilisant les technologies plus récentes (cartes vidéos, usb ...). Comme beaucoup de joueurs aiment jouer ensemble et souvent l'un après l'autre, je suggère d'ajouter un "Timer" un chronomètre avec possibilité de placer le temps voulu pour jouer un coup et que si le coup n'est pas réalisé dans ces temps, il y a pénalité d'un coup. Il manque encore une meilleure évaluation du terrain sur lequel la balle arrive ("heavy rough, light rough ...) et un pourcentage équivalent au risques encourus. Je recommanderais aussi (si c'est possible) une vue à partir des yeux du golfeur quand il "swing" comme possible position ainsi que certains outils pour analyser davantage le vert et faire un "chipping". Il semble que le jeu ne soit pas 3D mais ce n'est pas grave s'il est bien construit. Au début je n'aimais pas l'outil pour le swing, mais en l'étudiant davantage au Driving Range et sachant que si je vais vite la balle va à gauche et lent à droite en plus du tempo et du sweet spot, j'ai joué ensuite sans les aides et j'ai pû performer raisonnablement; indiquant qu'avec la pratique (comme au vrai golf) on peut s'améliorer. Je n'ai pas encore joué multiplayer, mais il va sans dire que la communication facile et la possibilité de sauver une partie en train de se jouer serait un avantage. Plusieurs d'entre nous seraient prêt à payer davantage soit sur le moment d'acheter le golf ou même après pour avoir certaines options (comme des bâtons et de l'équipement différent pour faire comme nous le faisons avec du vrai équipement). Une option comme pouvoir jouer avec une "board" du style P3ProSwing ou Optishot rendrait le jeu encore plus intéressant (de pouvoir jouer dans un garage avec des amis et leurs bâtons comme avec TW 2008). En gros le jeu est très prometteur et l'analyse du swing est de plus intéressante et motivante. Le plus nous serons proche de la réalité, le plus nous aurons du plaisir à le jouer (dans le mode réel : il ne faut pas faire l'erreur de rendre le golf plus facile car c'est ce qui enlève l'intérêt quand on voit qu'on drive 300 verges et qu'en réalité on en fait seulement 230); ceci pour dire que je préfère que Perfect Golf devienne LE Simulateur de golf par excellence. S'il est possible de fabriquer un terrain que nous préférons ou un que nous jouons déjà, ce serait un gros PLUS pour le programme et apporterait beaucoup d'avenir à Perfect Golf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171855226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 88350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1578079253}
review:
I've been following the development of this golf simulation for a fair while, really pleased to have a chance to play on EA.
I am using the three click meter, and having spent a bit of time on the practice range, I have just completed my first full round off of Members tees. I think they have got this just about spot-on as regards ball physics. I play golf off of a handicap of 12 and it is the first time I have played a golf simulation that just seems to feel right.

I have played golf games in the past, and you won't be seeing ridiculous rounds with scores in the 40's and 50's, you will not see this here. There are obviously areas where the sim can be improved, as would be expected for EA. I think some of the users who have been critical need to give the devs some time to get things implemented and improved upon, as I'm sure they will be.

I really think Perfect Golf has a bright future, especially when CourseForge is added.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119144356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1456385967}
review:
Even while being mindful of this being an Early Access release, this is still disappointing. And I wasn't even expecting a lot to begin with. When it works, the overall gameplay may be decribed as passable or rudimentary at best. When it doesn't, you will be struggling with all manner of bugs, glitches, and inconsistencies. From frequent crashes, to graphical glitches, to loss of chat features/interface. Admittedly, I am running the game on a near minimum requirements spec PC, so others may have a technically superiour experience, but I am, for example, literally unable to play two rounds in a row as the game crashes to desktop every single time I try to load a second round.

Motion swing controls are either broken or the developers simply don't understand what the whole point of being able to play by using your mouse as a club is. (It is to give the player the feel of actually swinging a club, in real time, and therefore requires 1:1 motion controls and respective visual representation. Another game achieved this perfectly, in 2001.)

Underwhelming at best. Every chance it will improve down the road, but impossible to recommend at this stage, particularly to those with lower specced PCs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991026549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1421990480}
review:
Game still needs a lot of work.

Graphics are just OK with current settings looks like something out of the 90s.
No support for a controller yet only three click swings or an awkward mouse meter.
The golf club seems to have better graphics and a lot more features and controller support but also has it's problems.
Lack of commentary on the golf course, some maybe OK with this, but the sound over all is pretty meh
It is early access, and I think the game has a mediocre foundation, but there is a lot of improvement needed at this point.
In my honest opinion if you're looking for a golf game on PC I would go with The Golf Club option, but beware it has it's quarks too.
